If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> presents the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> offered by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> would assign the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-i
paragraph.content: The assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-ii
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of origination discount points and points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6
paragraph.title: Applicability.
paragraph.content: Applicability. This paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> applies only if a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and is not violated if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> do not consummate a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-h
paragraph.title: Evasion; open-end credit.
paragraph.content: Evasion; <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref>. In connection with <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that does not meet the definition of <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> in § <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(20)</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not structure the loan as an open-end plan to evade the requirements of this section.

section.subject: § 1026.41 Periodic statements for residential mortgage loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-a
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-a-1
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. This section applies to a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, unless an exemption in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section applies. Such transactions are referred to as mortgage loans for the purposes of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-a-2
paragraph.title: Periodic statements.
paragraph.content: Periodic statements. A servicer of a transaction subject to this section shall provide the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, for each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>, a periodic statement meeting the requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-41-b" reftype="internal">(b)</ref>, <ref target="1026-41-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-41-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section. If a mortgage loan has a <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> shorter than a period of 31 days (for example, a bi-weekly <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>), a periodic statement covering an entire month may be used. For the purposes of this section, servicer includes the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer, as applicable. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee that does not currently own the mortgage loan or the mortgage servicing rights is not subject to the requirement in this section to provide a periodic statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-b
paragraph.title: Timing of the periodic statement.
paragraph.content: Timing of the periodic statement. The periodic statement must be delivered or placed in the mail within a reasonably prompt time after the payment due date or the end of any courtesy period provided for the previous <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-c
paragraph.title: Form of the periodic statement.
paragraph.content: Form of the periodic statement. The servicer must make the disclosures required by this section clearly and conspicuously in writing, or electronically if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> agrees, and in a form that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may keep. Sample forms for periodic statements are provided in appendix H-30. Proper use of these forms complies with the requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-41-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> and the layout requirements in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d
paragraph.title: Content and layout of the periodic statement.
paragraph.content: Content and layout of the periodic statement. The periodic statement required by this section shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1
paragraph.title: Amount due.
paragraph.content: Amount due. Grouped together in close proximity to each other and located at the top of the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-i
paragraph.content: The payment due date;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: The amount of any late payment fee, and the date on which that fee will be imposed if payment has not been received; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: The amount due, shown more prominently than other disclosures on the page and, if the transaction has multiple payment options, the amount due under each of the payment options.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2
paragraph.title: Explanation of amount due.
paragraph.content: Explanation of amount due. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The monthly payment amount, including a breakdown showing how much, if any, will be applied to principal, interest, and escrow and, if a mortgage loan has multiple payment options, a breakdown of each of the payment options along with information on whether the principal balance will increase, decrease, or stay the same for each option listed;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The total sum of any fees or charges imposed since the last statement; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: Any payment amount past due.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3
paragraph.title: Past Payment Breakdown.
paragraph.content: Past Payment Breakdown. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the last statement, including a breakdown showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, sent to any suspense or unapplied funds account; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the beginning of the current calendar year, including a breakdown of that total showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, currently held in any suspense or unapplied funds account.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-4
paragraph.title: Transaction activity.
paragraph.content: Transaction activity. A list of all the transaction activity that occurred since the last statement. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-4" reftype="internal">(d)(4)</ref>, transaction activity means any activity that causes a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> or debit to the amount currently due. This list must include the date of the transaction, a brief description of the transaction, and the amount of the transaction for each activity on the list.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-5
paragraph.title: Partial payment information.
paragraph.content: Partial payment information. If a statement reflects a partial payment that was placed in a suspense or unapplied funds account, information explaining what must be done for the funds to be applied. The information must be on the front page of the statement or, alternatively, may be included on a separate page enclosed with the periodic statement or in a separate letter.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-6
paragraph.title: Contact information.
paragraph.content: Contact information. A toll-free telephone number and, if applicable, an electronic mailing address that may be used by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to obtain information about the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s account, located on the front page of the statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7
paragraph.title: Account information.
paragraph.content: Account information. The following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-i
paragraph.content: The amount of the outstanding principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-ii
paragraph.content: The current interest rate in effect for the mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-iii
paragraph.content: The date after which the interest rate may next change;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-iv
paragraph.content: The existence of any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, that may be charged;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-v
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations and the HUD toll-free telephone number to access contact information for homeownership counselors or counseling organizations; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8
paragraph.title: Delinquency information.
paragraph.content: Delinquency information. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is more than 45 days delinquent, the following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement or, alternatively, on a separate page enclosed with the periodic statement or in a separate letter:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-i
paragraph.content: The date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> became delinquent;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-ii
paragraph.content: A notification of possible risks, such as foreclosure, and expenses, that may be incurred if the delinquency is not cured;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iii
paragraph.content: An account history showing, for the previous six months or the period since the last time the account was current, whichever is shorter, the amount remaining past due from each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> or, if any such payment was fully paid, the date on which it was credited as fully paid;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iv
paragraph.content: A notice indicating any loss mitigation program to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has agreed, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-v
paragraph.content: A notice of whether the servicer has made the first notice or filing required by applicable law for any judicial or non-judicial foreclosure process, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-vi
paragraph.content: The total payment amount needed to bring the account current; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-vii
paragraph.content: A reference to the homeownership counselor information disclosed pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-7-v" reftype="internal">(d)(7)(v)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-1
paragraph.title: Reverse mortgages.
paragraph.content: Reverse mortgages. <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">Reverse mortgage transactions</ref>, as defined by § <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="internal">1026.33(a)</ref>, are exempt from the requirements of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-2
paragraph.title: Timeshare plans.
paragraph.content: Timeshare plans. Transactions secured by <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>' interests in timeshare plans, as defined by <ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">11 U.S.C. 101</ref>(53D), are exempt from the requirements of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3
paragraph.title: Coupon books.
paragraph.content: Coupon books. The requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-41-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section do not apply to fixed-rate loans if the servicer:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-i
paragraph.content: Provides the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with a coupon book that includes on each coupon the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-ii
paragraph.content: Provides the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with a coupon book that includes anywhere in the coupon book:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-ii-A
paragraph.content: The account information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-7" reftype="internal">(d)(7)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: The contact information for the servicer, listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-6" reftype="internal">(d)(6)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-ii-C
paragraph.content: Information on how the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> can obtain the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-e-3-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(iii)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-iii
paragraph.content: Makes available upon request to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> by telephone, in writing, in <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, or electronically, if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> consents, the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-2" reftype="internal">(d)(2)</ref> through <ref target="1026-41-d-5" reftype="internal">(5)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-iv
paragraph.content: Provides the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-8" reftype="internal">(d)(8)</ref> of this section in writing, for any <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> during which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is more than 45 days delinquent.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4
paragraph.title: Small servicers.
paragraph.content: Small servicers.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-i
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer is exempt from the requirements of this section for mortgage loans serviced by a small servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii
paragraph.title: Small servicer defined.
paragraph.content: Small servicer defined. A small servicer is a servicer that either:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: Services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, for all of which the servicer (or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref>) is the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a Housing Finance Agency, as defined in <ref target="CFR:24-266-5" reftype="external">24 CFR 266.5</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii
paragraph.title: Small servicer determination.
paragraph.content: Small servicer determination. In determining whether a small servicer services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, a servicer is evaluated based on the number of mortgage loans serviced by the servicer and any <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> as of January 1 for the remainder of the calendar year. A servicer that crosses the threshold will have six months after crossing the threshold or until the next January 1, whichever is later, to comply with any requirements for which a servicer is no longer exempt as a small servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2
paragraph.content: Timing and content. Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (c)(2) of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 60, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 25, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for ARMs with uniformly scheduled interest rate adjustments occurring every 60 days or more frequently and for ARMs originated prior to January 10, 2015 in which the loan contract requires the adjusted interest rate and payment to be calculated based on the index figure available as of a date that is less than 45 days prior to the adjustment date. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> as soon as practicable, but not less than 25 days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due, for the first adjustment to an ARM if it occurs within 60 days of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was an estimate. The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and the interest rate and mortgage payment will change;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index, and any application of previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin or the application of any previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-3-i" reftype="internal">(c)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-b
paragraph.title: Prohibited acts or practices for dwelling-secured loans; open-end credit.
paragraph.content: Prohibited <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> or practices for <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>-secured loans; <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref>. In connection with <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that does not meet the definition in § <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(20)</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not structure a home-secured loan as an open-end plan to evade the requirements of § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The total loan amount for a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction is calculated by taking the amount financed, as determined according to § <ref target="1026-18-b" reftype="internal">1026.18(b)</ref>, and deducting any cost listed in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)(iii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-vi" reftype="internal">(vi)</ref> that is both included as points and fees under § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref> and financed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-i
paragraph.title: Mortgage-related obligations.
paragraph.content: Mortgage-related obligations. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref>, mortgage-related obligations are expected property taxes, premiums for mortgage-related insurance required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> as set forth in § <ref target="1026-35-b-3-i" reftype="internal">1026.35(b), and </ref>similar expenses.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">Loan originator</ref> qualification requirements. A <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref><ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">mer cre</ref>dit transa<ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">ction secu</ref>red b<ref target="1026-36-e" reftype="internal">y a</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> must, when required by applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law, be registered and licensed in ac<ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">cordance with</ref> those laws, including the Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 2008 (SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, 12 U.S.C. 5102 et seq.), its implementing regulations (12 CFR part 1007 or part 1008), and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law. To comply with this paragraph (f), a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> that is not a government agency or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance agency must:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-1
paragraph.content: Comply with all applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements for legal existence and foreign qualification;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-2
paragraph.content: Ensure that each <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who works for the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> is licensed or registered to the extent the individual is required to be licensed or registered under the SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, its implementing regulations, and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3
paragraph.content: For each of its <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> employees who is not required to be licensed and is not licensed as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> pursuant to § 1008.103 of this chapter or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i
paragraph.content: Obtain for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-A
paragraph.content: A criminal background check through the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLSR) or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, a criminal background check from a law enforcement agency or commercial service;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-B
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporting agency described in section 603(p) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>a(p)) secured, where applicable, in compliance with the requirements of section 604(b) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>b(b); and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-C
paragraph.content: Information from the NMLSR about any administrative, civil, or criminal findings by any government jurisdiction or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, such information from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii
paragraph.content: Determine on the basis of the information obtained pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-i" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(i)</ref> of this section and any other information reasonably available to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under this § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Has not been convicted of, or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony in a domestic or military court during the preceding seven-year period or, in the case of a felony involving an <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">act</ref> of fraud, dishonesty, a breach of trust, or money laundering, at any time;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii-A" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(ii)(A)</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-i
paragraph.content: A crime is a felony only if at the time of conviction it was classified as a felony under the law of the jurisdiction under which the individual was convicted;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-ii
paragraph.content: Expunged convictions and pardoned convictions do not render an individual unqualified; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-iii
paragraph.content: A conviction or plea of guilty or nolo contendere does not render an individual unqualified under this § <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)</ref> if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> has obtained consent to employ the individual from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (or the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, as applicable) pursuant to section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FDIA), <ref target="USC:12-1829" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1829</ref>, the National <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union Administration pursuant to section 205 of the Federal <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FCUA), <ref target="USC:12-1785" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1785</ref>(d), or the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Administration pursuant to section 5.65(d) of the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1971 (FCA), <ref target="USC:12-227" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 227</ref>a-14(d), notwithstanding the bars posed with respect to that conviction or plea by the FDIA, FCUA, and FCA, as applicable; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: Has demonstrated financial responsibility, character, and general fitness such as to warrant a determination that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> will operate honestly, fairly, and efficiently; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-iii
paragraph.content: Provide periodic training covering Federal and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements that apply to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s loan origination activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1-i
paragraph.content: The annual percentage rate at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> will exceed by more than 8 percentage points for first-lien loans, or by more than 10 percentage points for subordinate-lien loans, the yield on Treasury securities having comparable periods of maturity to the loan maturity as of the fifteenth day of the month immediately preceding the month in which the application for the extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> is received by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-24" reftype="term">residential mortgage transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: Insurance premiums described in paragraph (b)(1) of this section need not be included in escrow accounts for loans secured by <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref> in condominiums, planned unit developments, or other common interest communities in which <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> ownership requires participation in a governing association, where the governing association has an obligation to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> owners to maintain a master policy insuring all <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: A “loan originator organization” is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, that is not an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c
paragraph.title: Disclosures.
paragraph.content: Disclosures. In addition to other disclosures required by this part, in a mortgage subject to this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall disclose the following in conspicuous type size:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-1
paragraph.title: Notices.
paragraph.content: Notices. The following statement: “You are not required to complete this agreement merely because you have received these disclosures or have signed a loan application. If you obtain this loan, the lender will have a mortgage on your home. You could lose your home, and any money you have put into it, if you do not meet your obligations under the loan.”

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-2
paragraph.title: Annual percentage rate.
paragraph.content: Annual percentage rate. The annual percentage rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-3
paragraph.title: Regular payment; balloon payment.
paragraph.content: Regular payment; balloon payment. The amount of the regular monthly (or other periodic) payment and the amount of any balloon payment. The regular payment disclosed under this paragraph shall be treated as accurate if it is based on an amount borrowed that is deemed accurate and is disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-4
paragraph.title: Variable-rate.
paragraph.content: Variable-rate. For variable-rate transactions, a statement that the interest rate and monthly payment may increase, and the amount of the single maximum monthly payment, based on the maximum interest rate required to be disclosed under § <ref target="1026-30" reftype="internal">1026.30</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-5
paragraph.title: Amount borrowed.
paragraph.content: Amount borrowed. For a mortgage refinancing, the total amount the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will borrow, as reflected by the face amount of the note; and where the amount borrowed includes premiums or other charges for optional <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insurance or debt-cancellation coverage, that fact shall be stated, grouped together with the disclosure of the amount borrowed. The disclosure of the amount borrowed shall be treated as accurate if it is not more than $100 above or below the amount required to be disclosed.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3
paragraph.title: Loan options presented.
paragraph.content: Loan options presented. A transaction satisfies paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section only if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> presents the loan options required by that paragraph and all of the following conditions are met:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> must obtain loan options from a significant number of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> with which the originator regularly does business and, for each <ref target="1026-36-e-2" reftype="term">type of transaction</ref> in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> expressed an interest, must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with loan options that include:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-i-A
paragraph.content: The loan with the lowest interest rate;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-i-B
paragraph.content: The loan with the lowest interest rate without negative amortization, a prepayment penalty, interest-only payments, a balloon payment in the first 7 years of the life of the loan, a demand feature, shared equity, or shared appreciation; or, in the case of a reverse mortgage, a loan without a prepayment penalty, or shared equity or shared appreciation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-i-C
paragraph.content: The loan with the lowest total dollar amount of discount points, origination points or origination fees (or, if two or more loans have the same total dollar amount of discount points, origination points or origination fees, the loan with the lowest interest rate that has the lowest total dollar amount of discount points, origination points or origination fees).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> must have a good faith belief that the options presented to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section are loans for which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> likely qualifies.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-e-3-iii
paragraph.content: For each <ref target="1026-36-e-2" reftype="term">type of transaction</ref>, if the originator presents to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> more than three loans, the originator must highlight the loans that satisfy the criteria specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets, other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this subpart, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1
paragraph.content: In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref><ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">d-end cred</ref>it transaction, points and fees means the following fees or charges that are known at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i
paragraph.content: All items included in the finance charge un<ref target="1026-4-a" reftype="internal">der § 102</ref>6.4(a<ref target="1026-4-b" reftype="internal">) and (b)</ref>, except that the following items are excluded:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-A
paragraph.content: Interest or the time-price differential;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-B
paragraph.content: Any premium or other charge imposed in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program for any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C
paragraph.content: For any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss and that is not in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-1
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the entire amount of such premium or other charge; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-2
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the portion of any such premium or other charge that is not in excess of the amount payable under policies in effect at the time of origination under section 203(c)(2)(A) of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1709" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1709</ref>(c)(2)(A)), provided that the premium or charge is required to be refundable on a pro rata basis and the refund is automatically issued upon notification of the satisfaction of the underlying mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-D
paragraph.content: Any bona fide third-party charge not retained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either, unless the charge is required to be included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E
paragraph.content: Up to two bona fide discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than one percentage point; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than one percentage point; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F
paragraph.content: If no discount points have been excluded under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-E" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(E)</ref> of this section, then up to one bona fide discount point paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than two percentage points; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than two percentage points;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii
paragraph.content: All <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid directly or indirectly by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § 1026.36(a)(1), that can be attributed to that transaction at the time the interest rate is set unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, and already has been included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is an employee of the mortgage broker; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii
paragraph.content: All items listed in § <ref target="1026-4-c-7" reftype="internal">1026.4(c)(7)</ref> (other than amounts held for future payment of taxes), unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-A
paragraph.content: The charge is reasonable;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives no direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in connection with the charge; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-C
paragraph.content: The charge is not paid to an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iv
paragraph.content: Premiums or other charges payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> for any <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> life, <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> disability, <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> unemployment, or <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> property insurance, or any other life, accident, health, or loss-of-income insurance for which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is a beneficiary, or any payments directly or indirectly for any debt cancellation or suspension agreement or contract;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-v
paragraph.content: The maximum prepayment penalty, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">(b)(6)(i)</ref> of this section, that may be charged or collected under the terms of the mortgage loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-vi
paragraph.content: The total prepayment penalty, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">(b)(6)(i)</ref> of this section, incurred by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> refinances the existing mortgage loan with the current holder of the existing loan, a servicer acting on behalf of the current holder, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2
paragraph.content: [Reserved]<ref target="USC:12-1841" reftype="external"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: All <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid directly or indirectly by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, that can be attributed to that transaction at the time the interest rate is set unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, and already has been included in points and fees under paragraph (b)(2)(i) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is an employee of the mortgage broker; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3
paragraph.title: Bona fide discount point
paragraph.content: Bona fide discount point —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The term bona fide discount point means an amount equal to 1 percent of the loan amount paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> that reduces the interest rate or time-price differential applicable to the transaction based on a calculation that is consistent with established industry practices for determining the amount of reduction in the interest rate or time-price differential appropriate for the amount of discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4
paragraph.title: Total loan amount
paragraph.content: Total loan amount —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The total loan amount for a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction is calculated by taking the amount financed, as determined according to § <ref target="1026-18-b" reftype="internal">1026.18(b)</ref>, and deducting any cost listed in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)(iii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-vi" reftype="internal">(vi)</ref> that is both included as points and fees under § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref> and financed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-5
paragraph.content: Affiliate means any company that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with another company, as set forth in the Bank Holding Company <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1956 (<ref target="USC:12-1841" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1841</ref> et seq.).

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalty
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalty —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit transactions.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref> transactions. For a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction, prepayment penalty means a charge imposed for paying all or part of the transaction's principal before the date on which the principal is due, other than a waived, bona fide third-party charge that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> imposes if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> prepays all of the transaction's principal sooner than 36 months after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, provided, however, that interest charged consistent with the monthly interest accrual amortization method is not a prepayment penalty for extensions of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insured by the Federal Housing Administration that are consummated before January 21, 2015.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-2
paragraph.content: Ensure that each <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who works for the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> is licensed or registered to the extent the individual is required to be licensed or registered under the SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, its implementing regulations, and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3
paragraph.content: For each of its <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> employees who is not required to be licensed and is not licensed as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> pursuant to § 1008.103 of this chapter or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> implementing law:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i
paragraph.content: Obtain for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-A
paragraph.content: A criminal background check through the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLSR) or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, a criminal background check from a law enforcement agency or commercial service;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-B
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporting agency described in section 603(p) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>a(p)) secured, where applicable, in compliance with the requirements of section 604(b) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>b(b); and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-C
paragraph.content: Information from the NMLSR about any administrative, civil, or criminal findings by any government jurisdiction or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, such information from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii
paragraph.content: Determine on the basis of the information obtained pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-i" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(i)</ref> of this section and any other information reasonably available to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under this § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Has not been convicted of, or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony in a domestic or military court during the preceding seven-year period or, in the case of a felony involving an <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">act</ref> of fraud, dishonesty, a breach of trust, or money laundering, at any time;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii-A" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(ii)(A)</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-i
paragraph.content: A crime is a felony only if at the time of conviction it was classified as a felony under the law of the jurisdiction under which the individual was convicted;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-ii
paragraph.content: Expunged convictions and pardoned convictions do not render an individual unqualified; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-iii
paragraph.content: A conviction or plea of guilty or nolo contendere does not render an individual unqualified under this § <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)</ref> if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> has obtained consent to employ the individual from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (or the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, as applicable) pursuant to section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FDIA), <ref target="USC:12-1829" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1829</ref>, the National <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union Administration pursuant to section 205 of the Federal <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FCUA), <ref target="USC:12-1785" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1785</ref>(d), or the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Administration pursuant to section 5.65(d) of the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1971 (FCA), <ref target="USC:12-227" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 227</ref>a-14(d), notwithstanding the bars posed with respect to that conviction or plea by the FDIA, FCUA, and FCA, as applicable; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: Has demonstrated financial responsibility, character, and general fitness such as to warrant a determination that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> will operate honestly, fairly, and efficiently; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-iii
paragraph.content: Provide periodic training covering Federal and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements that apply to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s loan origination activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-1
paragraph.content: Comply with all applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements for legal existence and foreign qualification;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3
paragraph.title: Format.
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i
paragraph.content: Except for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section shall appear outside of and above the table required in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2
paragraph.title: Content.
paragraph.content: Content. If the new interest rate (or the new payment calculated from the new interest rate) is not known as of the date of the disclosure, an estimate shall be disclosed and labeled as such. This estimate shall be based on the calculation of the index reported in the source of information described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section within fifteen business days prior to the date of the disclosure. The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The date of the disclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and that any change in the interest rate may result in a change in the mortgage payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ix
paragraph.content: The telephone number of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer for <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to call if they anticipate not being able to make their new payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x
paragraph.content: The following alternatives to paying at the new rate that <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> may be able to pursue and a brief explanation of each alternative, expressed in simple and clear terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-C
paragraph.content: Modifying the terms of the loan with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-xi
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, the HUD toll-free telephone number to access the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> Web site to access contact information for <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance authorities (as defined in § 1301 of the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1989).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-v
