paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> satisfies the requirements stated in § <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-B" reftype="internal">(B)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: If the non-standard mortgage was consummated on or after January 10, 2014, the non-standard mortgage was made in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> or <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: The total points and fees payable by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> at or before loan closing will exceed the greater of 8 percent of the total loan amount, or $400; the $400 figure shall be adjusted annually on January 1 by the annual percentage change in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index that was reported on the preceding June 1.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii
paragraph.title: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans.
paragraph.content: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iii
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the loan do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on income from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment in determining repayment ability, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current employment status;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i
paragraph.content: Except for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: ARMs with terms of one year or less;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: A county is “rural” during a calendar year if it is neither in a metropolitan statistical area nor in a micropolitan statistical area that is adjacent to a metropolitan statistical area, as those terms are defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget and as they are applied under currently applicable Urban Influence Codes (UICs), established by the United <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">States</ref> Department of Agriculture's Economic Research Service (USDA-ERS). A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “rural” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (HMDA) data for the preceding calendar year, no more than two <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> extended covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, five or more times in the county. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> underwrites the loan, taking into account the monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: Periodic payments of principal and interest that will repay either:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The outstanding principal balance over the remaining term of the loan as of the date the interest rate adjusts to the maximum interest rate set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section, assuming the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have made all required payments as due prior to that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-31-c-1
paragraph.title: Disclosures for certain closed-end home mortgages.
paragraph.content: Disclosures for certain closed-end home mortgages. The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall furnish the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref> at least three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> prior to <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a mortgage transaction covered by § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-31-c-1-i
paragraph.title: Change in terms.
paragraph.content: Change in terms. After complying with paragraph <ref target="1026-31-c-1" reftype="internal">(c)(1)</ref> of this section and prior to <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> changes any term that makes the disclosures inaccurate, new disclosures shall be provided in accordance with the requirements of this subpart.

paragraph.label: 1026-31-c-1-ii
paragraph.title: Telephone disclosures.
paragraph.content: Telephone disclosures. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may provide new disclosures by telephone if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> initiates the change and if, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-31-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> provides new written disclosures; and

paragraph.label: 1026-31-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> sign a statement that the new disclosures were provided by telephone at least three days prior to <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-31-c-1-iii
paragraph.title: Consumer's waiver of waiting period before consummation.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref>'s waiver of waiting period before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>. The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may, after receiving the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-31-c-1" reftype="internal">(c)(1)</ref> of this section, modify or waive the three-day waiting period between delivery of those disclosures and <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> determines that the extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> is needed to meet a bona fide personal financial emergency. To modify or waive the right, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> shall give the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> a dated written statement that describes the emergency, specifically modifies or waives the waiting period, and bears the signature of all the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> entitled to the waiting period. Printed forms for this purpose are prohibited, except when <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> are permitted to use printed forms pursuant to § 1026.23(e)(2).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-ii
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4
paragraph.title: Small servicers.
paragraph.content: Small servicers.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-i
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer is exempt from the requirements of this section for mortgage loans serviced by a small servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii
paragraph.title: Small servicer defined.
paragraph.content: Small servicer defined. A small servicer is a servicer that either:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: Services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, for all of which the servicer (or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref>) is the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a Housing Finance Agency, as defined in <ref target="CFR:24-266-5" reftype="external">24 CFR 266.5</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii
paragraph.title: Small servicer determination.
paragraph.content: Small servicer determination. In determining whether a small servicer services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, a servicer is evaluated based on the number of mortgage loans serviced by the servicer and any <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> as of January 1 for the remainder of the calendar year. A servicer that crosses the threshold will have six months after crossing the threshold or until the next January 1, whichever is later, to comply with any requirements for which a servicer is no longer exempt as a small servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3
paragraph.title: Coupon books.
paragraph.content: Coupon books. The requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-41-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section do not apply to fixed-rate loans if the servicer:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-i
paragraph.content: Provides the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with a coupon book that includes on each coupon the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-ii
paragraph.content: Provides the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with a coupon book that includes anywhere in the coupon book:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-ii-A
paragraph.content: The account information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-7" reftype="internal">(d)(7)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: The contact information for the servicer, listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-6" reftype="internal">(d)(6)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-ii-C
paragraph.content: Information on how the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> can obtain the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-e-3-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(iii)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-iii
paragraph.content: Makes available upon request to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> by telephone, in writing, in <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, or electronically, if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> consents, the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-2" reftype="internal">(d)(2)</ref> through <ref target="1026-41-d-5" reftype="internal">(5)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-3-iv
paragraph.content: Provides the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> the information listed in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-8" reftype="internal">(d)(8)</ref> of this section in writing, for any <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> during which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is more than 45 days delinquent.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-2
paragraph.title: Timeshare plans.
paragraph.content: Timeshare plans. Transactions secured by <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>' interests in timeshare plans, as defined by <ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">11 U.S.C. 101</ref>(53D), are exempt from the requirements of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-1
paragraph.content: A home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> through <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-i
paragraph.content: A reverse mortgage subject to § <ref target="1026-33" reftype="internal">1026.33</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-ii
paragraph.content: A temporary or “bridge” loan with a term of 12 months or less, such as a loan to finance the purchase of a new <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> plans to sell a current <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> within 12 months or a loan to finance the initial construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-iii
paragraph.content: A construction phase of 12 months or less of a construction-to-permanent loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-iv
paragraph.content: An extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> made pursuant to a program administered by a Housing Finance Agency, as defined under <ref target="CFR:24-266-5" reftype="external">24 CFR 266.5</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v
paragraph.content: An extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> made by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> designated as a Community Development Financial Institution, as defined under <ref target="CFR:12-1805-104" reftype="external">12 CFR 1805.104</ref>(h);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v-B
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> designated as a <ref target="1026-2-a-18" reftype="term">Downpayment</ref> Assistance through Secondary Financing Provider, pursuant to <ref target="CFR:24-200-194" reftype="external">24 CFR 200.194</ref>(a), operating in accordance with regulations prescribed by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development applicable to such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">persons</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> designated as a Community Housing Development Organization provided that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has entered into a commitment with a participating jurisdiction and is undertaking a project under the HOME program, pursuant to the provisions of <ref target="CFR:24-92-300" reftype="external">24 CFR 92.300</ref>(a), and as the terms community housing development organization, commitment, participating jurisdiction, and project are defined under <ref target="CFR:24-92-2" reftype="external">24 CFR 92.2</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v-D
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> with a tax exemption ruling or determination letter from the Internal Revenue Service under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<ref target="USC:26-501" reftype="external">26 U.S.C. 501</ref>(c)(3); <ref target="CFR:26-1-501" reftype="external">26 CFR 1.501</ref>(c)(3)-1), provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v-D-1
paragraph.content: During the calendar year preceding receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> no more than 200 times;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v-D-2
paragraph.content: During the calendar year preceding receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> only to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> with income that did not exceed the low- and moderate-income household limit as established pursuant to section 102 of the Housing and Community Development <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1974 (<ref target="USC:42-5302" reftype="external">42 U.S.C. 5302</ref>(a)(20)) and amended from time to time by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development, pursuant to <ref target="CFR:24-570-3" reftype="external">24 CFR 570.3</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v-D-3
paragraph.content: The extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> is to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with income that does not exceed the household limit specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-a-3-v-D-2" reftype="internal">(a)(3)(v)(D)(2)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-v-D-4
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> determines, in accordance with written procedures, that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has a reasonable ability to repay the extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-vi
paragraph.content: An extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> made pursuant to a program authorized by sections 101 and 109 of the Emergency Economic Stabilization <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 2008 (<ref target="USC:12-5211" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 5211</ref>; 5219);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-2
paragraph.content: A mortgage transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan, as defined in <ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">11 U.S.C. 101</ref>(53(D)); or

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-1
paragraph.title: Reverse mortgages.
paragraph.content: Reverse mortgages. <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">Reverse mortgage transactions</ref>, as defined by § <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="internal">1026.33(a)</ref>, are exempt from the requirements of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-i
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph (d)(1)(iii) or (iv) of this section, in connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, no <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive and no <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> shall pay to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in an amount that is based on a term of a transaction, the terms of multiple transactions by an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, or the terms of multiple transactions by multiple <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originators</ref>. If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based in whole or in part on a factor that is a proxy for a term of a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based on a term of a transaction. A factor that is not itself a term of a transaction is a proxy for a term of the transaction if the factor consistently varies with that term over a significant number of transactions, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> has the ability, directly or indirectly, to add, drop, or change the factor in originating the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c
paragraph.content: Records related to certain requirements for mortgage loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-1
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2
paragraph.title: Records related to requirements for loan originator compensation.
paragraph.content: Records related to requirements for <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-25-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section, for transactions subject to § <ref target="1026-36" reftype="internal">1026.36</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it pays to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> agreement that governs those payments for three years after the date of payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)(iii)</ref>, shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it receives from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, or another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>; all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it pays to any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)(ii)</ref>; and the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> agreement that governs each such receipt or payment, for three years after the date of each such receipt or payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-3
paragraph.title: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a dwelling.
paragraph.content: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-25-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall retain evidence of compliance with § <ref target="1026-43" reftype="internal">1026.43</ref> of this regulation for three years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a transaction covered by that section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-2
paragraph.content: Fully amortizing payment means a periodic payment of principal and interest that will fully repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-3
paragraph.content: Fully indexed rate means the interest rate calculated using the index or formula that will apply after <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, as determined at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, and the maximum margin that can apply at any time during the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-17-a-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make the disclosures required by this subpart clearly and conspicuously in writing, in a form that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may keep. The disclosures required by this subpart may be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form, subject to compliance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> consent and other applicable provisions of the Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (E-Sign <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>) (<ref target="USC:15-7001" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 7001</ref> et seq.). The disclosures required by §§ <ref target="1026-17-g" reftype="internal">1026.17(g)</ref>, <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">1026.19(b)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-24" reftype="internal">1026.24</ref> may be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form without regard to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> consent or other provisions of the E-Sign <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> in the circumstances set forth in those sections. The disclosures shall be grouped together, shall be segregated from everything else, and shall not contain any information not directly related to the disclosures required under § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref>, § 10<ref target="1026-47" reftype="internal">26.20(c</ref>) and (d), or § 1026.47. The disclosures required by § 1026.20(d) shall be provided as a separate document from all other written materials. The disclosures may include an acknowledgment of receipt, the date of the transaction, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s name, address, and account <ref target="1026-18-a" reftype="internal">number. Th</ref>e following disclosures may be made <ref target="1026-18-f-1-iv" reftype="internal">together with or </ref>separately from other required disclosure<ref target="1026-18-n" reftype="internal">s: The cre</ref><ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s identity under § 1026.18(a), the variabl<ref target="1026-18-o" reftype="internal">e rate exa</ref>mple under § 1026.18(f)(1)(iv), insurance or debt<ref target="1026-18-c-1" reftype="internal"> cancellation</ref> under § 1026.18(n), and certain <ref target="1026-2-a-25" reftype="term">security interest</ref> ch<ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">arges u</ref>nder § 1026.18(o). The itemization of the amount financed under § 1026.18(<ref target="1026-47" reftype="internal">c)(1) m</ref>ust be separate from the other disclosures under § 1026.18, except for private education loan disclosures made in compliance with § 1026.47.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-6
paragraph.content: Loan term means the period of time to repay the obligation in full.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7
paragraph.content: Maximum loan amount means the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> plus any increase in principal balance that results from negative amortization, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, based on the terms of the legal obligation assuming:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes only the minimum periodic payments for the maximum possible time, until the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must begin making <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-ii
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate is reached at the earliest possible time.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-4
paragraph.content: Higher-priced covered transaction means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with an annual percentage rate that exceeds the average prime offer rate for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set by 1.5 or more percentage points for a first-lien <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, other than a qualified mortgage under paragraph (e)(5), (e)(6), or (f) of this section; by 3.5 or more percentage points for a first-lien <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that is a qualified mortgage under paragraph (e)(5), (e)(6), or (f) of this section; or by 3.5 or more percentage points for a subordinate-lien <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-5
paragraph.content: Loan amount means the principal amount the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will borrow as reflected in the promissory note or loan contract.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-8
paragraph.content: Mortgage-related obligations mean property taxes; premiums and similar charges identified in § <ref target="1026-4-b-5" reftype="internal">1026.4(b)(5)</ref>, <ref target="1026-4-b-7" reftype="internal">(7)</ref>, <ref target="1026-4-b-8" reftype="internal">(8)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-4-b-10" reftype="internal">(10)</ref> that are required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; fees and special assessments imposed by a condominium, cooperative, or homeowners association; ground rent; and leasehold payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-9
paragraph.content: Points and fees has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">oan or</ref>iginator may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-2" reftype="internal">dual l</ref>oan originator, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in the form of a contribution to a defined contribution plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan or a benefit under a defined benefit plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan. In the case of a contribution to a defined contribution plan, the contribution shall not be directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions. As used in this paragraph (d)(1)(iii), “designated tax-advantaged plan” means any plan that meets the requirements of Internal Revenue Code section 401(a), 26 U.S.C. 401(a); employee annuity plan described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(a), 26 U.S.C. 403(a); simple retirement account, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 408(p), 26 U.S.C. 408(p); simplified employee pension described in Internal Revenue Code section 408(k), 26 U.S.C. 408(k); annuity contract described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(b), 26 U.S.C. 403(b); or eligible deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 457(b), 26 U.S.C. 457(b).

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F
paragraph.content: If no discount points have been excluded under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-E" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(E)</ref> of this section, then up to one bona fide discount point paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than two percentage points; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than two percentage points;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> do not apply to:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: ARMs with terms of one year or less;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: The first interest rate adjustment to an ARM if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">1026.20(d)</ref> was not an estimate; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-D
paragraph.content: Any bona fide third-party charge not retained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either, unless the charge is required to be included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E
paragraph.content: Up to two bona fide discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than one percentage point; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than one percentage point; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-B
paragraph.content: Any premium or other charge imposed in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program for any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C
paragraph.content: For any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss and that is not in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-1
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the entire amount of such premium or other charge; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-2
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the portion of any such premium or other charge that is not in excess of the amount payable under policies in effect at the time of origination under section 203(c)(2)(A) of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1709" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1709</ref>(c)(2)(A)), provided that the premium or charge is required to be refundable on a pro rata basis and the refund is automatically issued upon notification of the satisfaction of the underlying mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-iii
paragraph.content: A construction phase of 12 months or less of a construction-to-permanent loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-A
paragraph.content: Interest or the time-price differential;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-iii
paragraph.content: Provide periodic training covering Federal and <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law requirements that apply to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s loan origination activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4
paragraph.title: Total loan amount
paragraph.content: Total loan amount —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The total loan amount for a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction is calculated by taking the amount financed, as determined according to § <ref target="1026-18-b" reftype="internal">1026.18(b)</ref>, and deducting any cost listed in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)(iii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-vi" reftype="internal">(vi)</ref> that is both included as points and fees under § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref> and financed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-3
paragraph.title: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a dwelling.
paragraph.content: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-25-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall retain evidence of compliance with § <ref target="1026-43" reftype="internal">1026.43</ref> of this regulation for three years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a transaction covered by that section.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2
paragraph.title: Records related to requirements for loan originator compensation.
paragraph.content: Records related to requirements for <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-25-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section, for transactions subject to § <ref target="1026-36" reftype="internal">1026.36</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it pays to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> agreement that governs those payments for three years after the date of payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)(iii)</ref>, shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it receives from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, or another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>; all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it pays to any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)(ii)</ref>; and the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> agreement that governs each such receipt or payment, for three years after the date of each such receipt or payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under a non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan (i.e., any arrangement for the payment of non-deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> that is determined with reference to the profits of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> from mortgage-related business), provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: At least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> was a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for ten or fewer transactions subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> consummated during the 12-month period preceding the date of the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> determination.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c
paragraph.title: Servicing practices.
paragraph.content: Servicing practices. For purposes of this paragraph (c), the terms “servicer” and “servicing” have the same meanings as provided in 12 CFR 1024.2(b).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1
paragraph.content: Payment processing. In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-i
paragraph.content: Periodic payments. No servicer shall fail to <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> a periodic payment to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s loan account as of the date of receipt, except when a delay in crediting does not result in any charge to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or in the reporting of negative information to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporti<ref target="1026-36-c-2" reftype="internal">ng age</ref>ncy, or except as provided in paragraph (c)(1)(iii) of this section. A periodic payment, as used in this paragraph (c), is an amount sufficient to cover principal, interest, and escrow (if applicable) for a given <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>. A payment qualifies as a periodic payment even if it does not include amounts required to cover late fees, other fees, or non-escrow payments a servicer has advanced on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s behalf.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii
paragraph.content: Partial payments. Any servicer that retains a partial payment, meaning any payment less than a periodic payment, in a suspense or unapplied funds account shall:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Disclose to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> the total amount of funds held in such suspense or unapplied funds account on the periodic statement as required by § <ref target="1026-41-d-3" reftype="internal">1026.41(d)(3)</ref>, if a periodic statement is required; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: On accumulation of sufficient funds to cover a periodic payment in any suspense or unapplied funds account, treat such funds as a periodic payment received in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-36-c-1-i" reftype="internal">(c)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-iii
paragraph.content: Non-conforming payments. If a servicer specifies in writing requirements for the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to follow in making payments, but accepts a payment that does not conform to the requirements, the servicer shall <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> the payment as of five days after receipt.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2
paragraph.content: No pyramiding of late fees. In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a servicer shall not impose any late fee or delinquency charge for a payment if:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2-i
paragraph.content: Such a fee or charge is attributable solely to failure of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to pay a late fee or delinquency charge on an earlier payment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: The payment is otherwise a periodic payment received on the due date, or within any applicable courtesy period.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-3
paragraph.content: Payoff statements. In connectio<ref target="1026-36-c" reftype="internal">n w</ref>ith a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref><ref target="CFR:12-1024-2" reftype="external">r, assignee o</ref>r servicer, as applicable, must provide an accurate statement of the total outstanding balance that would be required to pay the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s obligation in full as of a specified date. The statement shall be sent within a reasonable time, but in no case more than seven business days, after receiving a written request from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> acting on behalf of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>. When a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer, as applicable, is not able to provide the statement within seven business days of such a request because a loan is in bankruptcy or foreclosure, because the loan is a reverse mortgage or shared appreciation mortgage, or because of natural disasters or other similar circumstances, the payoff statement must be provided within a reasonable time. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee that does not currently own the mortgage loan or the mortgage servicing rights is not subject to the requirement in this paragraph (c)(3) to provide a payoff statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: Determines the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability using the largest payment of principal and interest scheduled in the first seven years following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and taking into account current obligations and mortgage-related obligations as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-i" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(i)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must calculate the monthly payment for a non-standard mortgage based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> of principal and interest using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> as of a reasonable period of time before or after the date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-B
paragraph.content: The term of the loan remaining as of the date on which the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> occurs, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C
paragraph.content: A remaining <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-1
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-A" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(A)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-2
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-B" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(B)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-3
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref>, determined after adjusting for the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-a-1
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. This section applies to a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, unless an exemption in paragraph <ref target="1026-41-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section applies. Such transactions are referred to as mortgage loans for the purposes of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations, alimony, and child support in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-3" reftype="internal">(c)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-ii
paragraph.content: A home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref>, by using the periodic payment required under the terms of the plan and the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> to be drawn at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> only, a “term of a transaction” is any right or obligation of the parties to a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> transaction. The amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended is not a term of a transaction or a proxy for a term of a transaction, provided that <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> received by or paid to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, is based on a fixed percentage of the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended; however, such <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> may be subject to a minimum or maximum dollar amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-3
paragraph.title: Compensation.
paragraph.content: Compensation. The term “compensation” includes salaries, commissions, and any financial or similar incentive.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-2
paragraph.title: Mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Mortgage broker. For purposes of this section, a mortgage broker with respect to a particular transaction is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is not an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5
paragraph.title: Seller financers; one property.
paragraph.content: Seller financers; one property. A natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust that meets all of the following criteria is not a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-i
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust provides seller financing for the sale of only one property in any 12-month period to purchasers of such property, which is owned by the natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust and serves as security for the financing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-ii
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust has not constructed, or acted as a contractor for the construction of, a residence on the property in the ordinary course of business of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust provides seller financing that meets the following requirements:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii-A
paragraph.content: The financing has a repayment schedule that does not result in negative amortization.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii-B
paragraph.content: The financing has a fixed rate or an adjustable rate that is adjustable after five or more years, subject to reasonable annual and lifetime limitations on interest rate increases. If the financing agreement has an adjustable rate, the rate is determined by the addition of a margin to an index rate and is subject to reasonable rate adjustment limitations. The index the adjustable rate is based on is a widely available index such as indices for U.S. Treasury securities or LIBOR.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4
paragraph.title: Seller financers; three properties.
paragraph.content: Seller financers; three properties. A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> (as defined in § <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(22)</ref>) that meets all of the following criteria is not a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> provides seller financing for the sale of three or fewer properties in any 12-month period to purchasers of such properties, each of which is owned by the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> and serves as security for the financing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has not constructed, or acted as a contractor for the construction of, a residence on the property in the ordinary course of business of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> provides seller financing that meets the following requirements:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-A
paragraph.content: The financing is fully amortizing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: The financing is one that the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> determines in good faith the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has a reasonable ability to repay.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-C
paragraph.content: The financing has a fixed rate or an adjustable rate that is adjustable after five or more years, subject to reasonable annual and lifetime limitations on interest rate increases. If the financing agreement has an adjustable rate, the rate is determined by the addition of a margin to an index rate and is subject to reasonable rate adjustment limitations. The index the adjustable rate is based on is a widely available index such as indices for U.S. Treasury securities or LIBOR.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that are substantially equal, except for the effect that any interest rate change after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> has on the payment in the case of an adjustable-rate or step-rate mortgage, that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Result in an increase of the principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-B
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-iv
paragraph.content: An extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> made pursuant to a program administered by a Housing Finance Agency, as defined under <ref target="CFR:24-266-5" reftype="external">24 CFR 266.5</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g
paragraph.content: Name and NMLSR ID on loan documents.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-1
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> must include on the loan documents described in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-g-2" reftype="internal">(g)(2)</ref> of this section, whenever each such loan document is provided to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or presented to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> for signature, as applicable:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-1-i
paragraph.content: Its name and NMLSR ID, if the NMLSR has provided it an NMLSR ID; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-1-ii
paragraph.content: The name of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> (as the name appears in the NMLSR) with primary responsibility for the origination and, if the NMLSR has provided such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> an NMLSR ID, that NMLSR ID.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2
paragraph.content: The loan documents that must include the names and NMLSR IDs pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-g-1" reftype="internal">(g)(1)</ref> of this section are:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> application;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2-iii
paragraph.content: The note or loan contract; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2-iv
paragraph.content: The security instrument.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-3
paragraph.content: For purposes of this section, NMLSR ID means a number assigned by the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry to facilitate electronic tracking and uniform identification of <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originators</ref> and public access to the employment history of, and the publicly adjudicated disciplinary and enforcement actions against, <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originators</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The date of the disclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-iii
paragraph.title: Refinancing.
paragraph.content: Refinancing. The term refinancing has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the monthly payment for a standard mortgage must be based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> based on the maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h
paragraph.title: Prohibition on mandatory arbitration clauses and waivers of certain consumer rights.
paragraph.content: Prohibition on mandatory arbitration clauses and waivers of certain <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> rights.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h-1
paragraph.title: Arbitration.
paragraph.content: Arbitration. A contract or other agreement for a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) may not include terms that require arbitration or any other non-judicial procedure to resolve any controversy or settle any claims arising out of the transaction. This prohibition does not limit a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or any assignee from agreeing, after a dispute or claim under the transaction arises, to settle or use arbitration or other non-judicial procedure to resolve that dispute or claim.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-h-2
paragraph.title: No waivers of Federal statutory causes of action.
paragraph.content: No waivers of Federal statutory causes of action. A contract or other agreement relating to a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) may not be applied or interpreted to bar a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> from bringing a claim in court pursuant to any provision of law for damages or other relief in connection with any alleged violation of any Federal law. This prohibition does not limit a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or any assignee from agreeing, after a dispute or claim under the transaction arises, to settle or use arbitration or other non-judicial procedure to resolve that dispute or claim.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-vi
paragraph.content: The total prepayment penalty, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">(b)(6)(i)</ref> of this section, incurred by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> refinances the existing mortgage loan with the current holder of the existing loan, a servicer acting on behalf of the current holder, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x
paragraph.content: The following alternatives to paying at the new rate that <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> may be able to pursue and a brief explanation of each alternative, expressed in simple and clear terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-C
paragraph.content: Modifying the terms of the loan with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties that are either “rural” or “underserved,” as set forth in paragraph (b)(2)(iv) of th<ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">is section</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii
paragraph.content: All <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid directly or indirectly by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § 1026.36(a)(1), that can be attributed to that transaction at the time the interest rate is set unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, and already has been included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is an employee of the mortgage broker; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-i
paragraph.content: A reverse mortgage subject to § <ref target="1026-33" reftype="internal">1026.33</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j
paragraph.title: Policies and procedures to ensure and monitor compliance.
paragraph.content: Policies and procedures to ensure and monitor compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j-1
paragraph.content: A depository institution must establish and maintain written policies and procedures reasonably designed to ensure and monitor the compliance of the depository institution, its employees, its subsidiaries, and its subsidiaries' employees with the requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-36-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> of this section. These written policies and procedures must be appropriate to the nature, size, complexity, and scope of the mortgage lending activities of the depository institution and its subsidiaries.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-j" reftype="internal">(j)</ref>, “depository institution” has the meaning in section 1503(2) of the SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-5102" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 5102</ref>(2). For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-j" reftype="internal">(j)</ref>, “subsidiary” has the meaning in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-1813" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1813</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d
paragraph.title: Content and layout of the periodic statement.
paragraph.content: Content and layout of the periodic statement. The periodic statement required by this section shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1
paragraph.title: Amount due.
paragraph.content: Amount due. Grouped together in close proximity to each other and located at the top of the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-i
paragraph.content: The payment due date;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: The amount of any late payment fee, and the date on which that fee will be imposed if payment has not been received; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: The amount due, shown more prominently than other disclosures on the page and, if the transaction has multiple payment options, the amount due under each of the payment options.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2
paragraph.title: Explanation of amount due.
paragraph.content: Explanation of amount due. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The monthly payment amount, including a breakdown showing how much, if any, will be applied to principal, interest, and escrow and, if a mortgage loan has multiple payment options, a breakdown of each of the payment options along with information on whether the principal balance will increase, decrease, or stay the same for each option listed;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The total sum of any fees or charges imposed since the last statement; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: Any payment amount past due.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3
paragraph.title: Past Payment Breakdown.
paragraph.content: Past Payment Breakdown. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the last statement, including a breakdown showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, sent to any suspense or unapplied funds account; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the beginning of the current calendar year, including a breakdown of that total showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, currently held in any suspense or unapplied funds account.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-4
paragraph.title: Transaction activity.
paragraph.content: Transaction activity. A list of all the transaction activity that occurred since the last statement. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-4" reftype="internal">(d)(4)</ref>, transaction activity means any activity that causes a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> or debit to the amount currently due. This list must include the date of the transaction, a brief description of the transaction, and the amount of the transaction for each activity on the list.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-5
paragraph.title: Partial payment information.
paragraph.content: Partial payment information. If a statement reflects a partial payment that was placed in a suspense or unapplied funds account, information explaining what must be done for the funds to be applied. The information must be on the front page of the statement or, alternatively, may be included on a separate page enclosed with the periodic statement or in a separate letter.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-6
paragraph.title: Contact information.
paragraph.content: Contact information. A toll-free telephone number and, if applicable, an electronic mailing address that may be used by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to obtain information about the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s account, located on the front page of the statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7
paragraph.title: Account information.
paragraph.content: Account information. The following information:
