paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> was a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for ten or fewer transactions subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> consummated during the 12-month period preceding the date of the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> determination.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: Exemption. A payment to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is otherwise prohibited by section 129B(c)(2)(A) of the Truth in Lending <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> is nevertheless permitted pursuant to section 129B(c)(2)(B) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, regardless of whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes any upfront payment of discount points, origination points, or fees, as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, as long as the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> does not receive any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(i) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i
paragraph.content: All items included in the finance charge un<ref target="1026-4-a" reftype="internal">der § 102</ref>6.4(a<ref target="1026-4-b" reftype="internal">) and (b)</ref>, except that the following items are excluded:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-A
paragraph.content: Interest or the time-price differential;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-B
paragraph.content: Any premium or other charge imposed in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program for any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C
paragraph.content: For any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss and that is not in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-1
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the entire amount of such premium or other charge; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-2
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the portion of any such premium or other charge that is not in excess of the amount payable under policies in effect at the time of origination under section 203(c)(2)(A) of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1709" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1709</ref>(c)(2)(A)), provided that the premium or charge is required to be refundable on a pro rata basis and the refund is automatically issued upon notification of the satisfaction of the underlying mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-D
paragraph.content: Any bona fide third-party charge not retained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either, unless the charge is required to be included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E
paragraph.content: Up to two bona fide discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than one percentage point; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than one percentage point; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F
paragraph.content: If no discount points have been excluded under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-E" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(E)</ref> of this section, then up to one bona fide discount point paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than two percentage points; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than two percentage points;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit transactions.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref> transactions. For a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction, prepayment penalty means a charge imposed for paying all or part of the transaction's principal before the date on which the principal is due, other than a waived, bona fide third-party charge that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> imposes if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> prepays all of the transaction's principal sooner than 36 months after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, provided, however, that interest charged consistent with the monthly interest accrual amortization method is not a prepayment penalty for extensions of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insured by the Federal Housing Administration that are consummated before January 21, 2015.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> do not apply to ARMs with terms of one year or less.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, by following paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref>of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no more than one payment more than 30 days late on the non-standard mortgage during the 12 months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-v
paragraph.content: The maximum prepayment penalty, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">(b)(6)(i)</ref> of this section, that may be charged or collected under the terms of the mortgage loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i
paragraph.content: Obtain for any individual whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired on or after January 10, 2014 (or whom the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> hired before this date but for whom there were no applicable statutory or regulatory background standards in effect at the time of hire or before January 10, 2014, used to screen the individual) and for any individual regardless of when hired who, based on reliable information known to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, likely does not meet the standards under § <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)(3)(ii)</ref>, before the individual <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> as a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-A
paragraph.content: A criminal background check through the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLSR) or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, a criminal background check from a law enforcement agency or commercial service;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-B
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> reporting agency described in section 603(p) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>a(p)) secured, where applicable, in compliance with the requirements of section 604(b) of the Fair <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Reporting <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:15-1681" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1681</ref>b(b); and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-i-C
paragraph.content: Information from the NMLSR about any administrative, civil, or criminal findings by any government jurisdiction or, in the case of an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> who is not a registered <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under the NMLSR, such information from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-c-1-iii
paragraph.content: Non-conforming payments. If a servicer specifies in writing requirements for the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to follow in making payments, but accepts a payment that does not conform to the requirements, the servicer shall <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> the payment as of five days after receipt.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin or the application of any previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i
paragraph.title: General rule.
paragraph.content: General rule. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(5)(ii)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-B
paragraph.content: Monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> that are substantially equal.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5
paragraph.title: Payment calculations.
paragraph.content: Payment calculations. For purposes of determining whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment for a standard mortgage will be materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, the following provisions shall be used:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must calculate the monthly payment for a non-standard mortgage based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> of principal and interest using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> as of a reasonable period of time before or after the date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-B
paragraph.content: The term of the loan remaining as of the date on which the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> occurs, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C
paragraph.content: A remaining <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-1
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-A" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(A)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-2
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-B" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(B)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-3
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref>, determined after adjusting for the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the monthly payment for a standard mortgage must be based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> based on the maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: Has demonstrated financial responsibility, character, and general fitness such as to warrant a determination that the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> will operate honestly, fairly, and efficiently; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Has not been convicted of, or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony in a domestic or military court during the preceding seven-year period or, in the case of a felony involving an <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">act</ref> of fraud, dishonesty, a breach of trust, or money laundering, at any time;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-f-3-ii-A" reftype="internal">(f)(3)(ii)(A)</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-i
paragraph.content: A crime is a felony only if at the time of conviction it was classified as a felony under the law of the jurisdiction under which the individual was convicted;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-ii
paragraph.content: Expunged convictions and pardoned convictions do not render an individual unqualified; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-f-3-ii-A-2-iii
paragraph.content: A conviction or plea of guilty or nolo contendere does not render an individual unqualified under this § <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">1026.36(f)</ref> if the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> has obtained consent to employ the individual from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (or the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, as applicable) pursuant to section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FDIA), <ref target="USC:12-1829" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1829</ref>, the National <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union Administration pursuant to section 205 of the Federal <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Union <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FCUA), <ref target="USC:12-1785" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1785</ref>(d), or the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Administration pursuant to section 5.65(d) of the Farm <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1971 (FCA), <ref target="USC:12-227" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 227</ref>a-14(d), notwithstanding the bars posed with respect to that conviction or plea by the FDIA, FCUA, and FCA, as applicable; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d
paragraph.content: Initial rate adjustment. The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer of an adjustable-rate mortgage shall provide <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> with disclosures, as described in this paragraph (d), in c<ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">onn</ref>ection with the initial interest rate adjustment pursuant to the loan contract. To the extent that other provisions of this subpart C govern the disclosures required by this paragraph (d), those provisions apply to assignees and servicers as well as to <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>. The disclosures required by this paragraph (d) shall be provided as a separate document from other documents provided by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 210, but no more than 240, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. If the first payment at the adjusted level is due within the first 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the disclosures shall be provided at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1
paragraph.title: Coverage.
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> do not apply to ARMs with terms of one year or less.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2
paragraph.title: Content.
paragraph.content: Content. If the new interest rate (or the new payment calculated from the new interest rate) is not known as of the date of the disclosure, an estimate shall be disclosed and labeled as such. This estimate shall be based on the calculation of the index reported in the source of information described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section within fifteen business days prior to the date of the disclosure. The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The date of the disclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and that any change in the interest rate may result in a change in the mortgage payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ix
paragraph.content: The telephone number of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer for <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to call if they anticipate not being able to make their new payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x
paragraph.content: The following alternatives to paying at the new rate that <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> may be able to pursue and a brief explanation of each alternative, expressed in simple and clear terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-C
paragraph.content: Modifying the terms of the loan with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-xi
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, the HUD toll-free telephone number to access the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> Web site to access contact information for <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance authorities (as defined in § 1301 of the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1989).

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3
paragraph.title: Format.
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i
paragraph.content: Except for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section shall appear outside of and above the table required in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. The provisions of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> apply to the refinancing of a non-standard mortgage into a standard mortgage when the following conditions are met:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> for the standard mortgage is the current holder of the existing non-standard mortgage or the servicer acting on behalf of the current holder;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The monthly payment for the standard mortgage is materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, as calculated under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-5" reftype="internal">(d)(5)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage no later than two months after the non-standard mortgage has <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no more than one payment more than 30 days late on the non-standard mortgage during the 12 months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no payments more than 30 days late during the six months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: If the non-standard mortgage was consummated on or after January 10, 2014, the non-standard mortgage was made in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> or <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c
paragraph.title: Variable-rate adjustments.
paragraph.content: Rate adjustments with a corresponding change in payment. Th<ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">e c</ref><ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer of an adjustable-rate mortgage shall provide <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> with disclosures, as described in this paragraph (c), in connection w<ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">ith the ad</ref>justment of interest rates pursuant to the loan contract that results in a corresponding adjustment to the payment. To the extent that other provisions of this subpart C govern the disclosures required by this paragraph (c), those provisions apply to assignees and servicers as well as to <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>. The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) also shall be provided for an interest rate adjustment resulting from the conversion of an adjustable-rate mortgage to a fixed-rate transaction, if that interest rate adjustment results in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> do not apply to:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: ARMs with terms of one year or less;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: The first interest rate adjustment to an ARM if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">1026.20(d)</ref> was not an estimate; or

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2
paragraph.content: Timing and content. Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (c)(2) of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 60, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 25, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for ARMs with uniformly scheduled interest rate adjustments occurring every 60 days or more frequently and for ARMs originated prior to January 10, 2015 in which the loan contract requires the adjusted interest rate and payment to be calculated based on the index figure available as of a date that is less than 45 days prior to the adjustment date. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> as soon as practicable, but not less than 25 days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due, for the first adjustment to an ARM if it occurs within 60 days of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was an estimate. The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and the interest rate and mortgage payment will change;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index, and any application of previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin or the application of any previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-3-i" reftype="internal">(c)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(1)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(1)</ref> and (2) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-23-a-3-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-23-a-3" reftype="internal">(a)(3)</ref>, the term “material disclosures” means the required disclosures of the annual percentage rate, the finance charge, the amount financed, the total of payments, the payment schedule, and the disclosures and limitations referred to in §§ <ref target="1026-32-c" reftype="internal">1026.32(c)</ref> and <ref target="1026-32-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> and <ref target="1026-35-b-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(e)(2)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii
paragraph.content: All items listed in § <ref target="1026-4-c-7" reftype="internal">1026.4(c)(7)</ref> (other than amounts held for future payment of taxes), unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-A
paragraph.content: The charge is reasonable;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives no direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in connection with the charge; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-C
paragraph.content: The charge is not paid to an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a
paragraph.title: General rule
paragraph.content: General rule —

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-1-i
paragraph.title: Consideration of ability to pay.
paragraph.content: Consideration of ability to pay. A <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> must not open a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account for a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> under an open-end (not home-secured) <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> plan, or increase any <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit applicable to such account, unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> considers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s ability to make the required minimum periodic payments under the terms of the account based on the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets and the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-1-ii
paragraph.title: Reasonable policies and procedures.
paragraph.content: Reasonable policies and procedures. <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">Card issuers</ref> must establish and maintain reasonable written policies and procedures to consider the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s ability to make the required minimum payments under the terms of the account based on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets and a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current obligations. Reasonable policies and procedures include treating any income and assets to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has a reasonable expectation of access as the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets, or limiting consideration of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s independent income and assets. Reasonable policies and procedures also include consideration of at least one of the following: The ratio of debt obligations to income; the ratio of debt obligations to assets; or the income the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have after paying debt obligations. It would be unreasonable for a <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> not to review any information about a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets and current obligations, or to issue a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> who does not have any income or assets.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2
paragraph.title: Minimum periodic payments
paragraph.content: Minimum periodic payments —

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-i
paragraph.title: Reasonable method.
paragraph.content: Reasonable method. For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-51-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> must use a reasonable method for estimating the minimum periodic payments the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> would be required to pay under the terms of the account.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii
paragraph.title: Safe harbor.
paragraph.content: Safe harbor. A <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> complies with paragraph <ref target="1026-51-a-2-i" reftype="internal">(a)(2)(i)</ref> of this section if it estimates required minimum periodic payments using the following method:

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> assumes utilization, from the first day of the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>, of the full <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> line that the issuer is considering offering to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> uses a minimum payment formula employed by the issuer for the product the issuer is considering offering to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or, in the case of an existing account, the minimum payment formula that currently applies to that account, provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: If the applicable minimum payment formula includes interest charges, the <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> estimates those charges using an interest rate that the issuer is considering offering to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> for purchases or, in the case of an existing account, the interest rate that currently applies to purchases; and

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: If the applicable minimum payment formula includes mandatory fees, the <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> must assume that such fees have been charged to the account.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b
paragraph.title: Rules affecting young consumers
paragraph.content: Rules affecting young <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>—

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-1
paragraph.title: Applications from young consumers.
paragraph.content: Applications from young <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>. A <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> may not open a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account under an open-end (not home-secured) <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> plan for a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> less than 21 years old, unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has submitted a written application and the <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> has:

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-1-i
paragraph.content: Financial information indicating the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has an independent ability to make the required minimum periodic payments on the proposed extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> in connection with the account; or<ref target="1026-51-a" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: A signed agreement of a cosigner, guarantor, or joint applicant who is at least 21 years old to be either secondarily liable for any debt on the account incurred by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has attained the age of 21 or jointly liable with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> for any debt on the account; and

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: Financial information indicating such cosigner, guarantor, or joint applicant has the ability to make the required minimum periodic payments on such debts, consistent with paragraph (a) of this <ref target="1026-51-a" reftype="internal">sec</ref>tion.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2
paragraph.title: Credit line increases for young consumers.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> line increases for young <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>. <ref target="1026-51-b-1-ii" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2-i
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account has been opened pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-51-b-1-i" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, no increase in the <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit may be made on such account before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> attains the age of 21 unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2-i-A
paragraph.content: At the time of the contemplated increase, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has an independent ability to make the required minimum periodic payments on the increased limit consistent with paragraph <ref target="1026-51-b-1-i" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2-i-B
paragraph.content: A cosigner, guarantor, or joint applicant who is at least 21 years old agrees in writing to assume liability for any debt incurred on the account, consistent with paragraph <ref target="1026-51-b-1-ii" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account has been opened pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-51-b-1-ii" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, no increase in the <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit may be made on such account before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> attains the age of 21 unless the cosigner, guarantor, or joint accountholder who assumed liability at account opening agrees in writing to assume liability on the increase.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2
paragraph.content: The loan documents that must include the names and NMLSR IDs pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-g-1" reftype="internal">(g)(1)</ref> of this section are:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> application;

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2-iii
paragraph.content: The note or loan contract; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-2-iv
paragraph.content: The security instrument.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-1
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> must include on the loan documents described in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-g-2" reftype="internal">(g)(2)</ref> of this section, whenever each such loan document is provided to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or presented to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> for signature, as applicable:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-1-i
paragraph.content: Its name and NMLSR ID, if the NMLSR has provided it an NMLSR ID; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-g-1-ii
paragraph.content: The name of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> (as the name appears in the NMLSR) with primary responsibility for the origination and, if the NMLSR has provided such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> an NMLSR ID, that NMLSR ID.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage no later than two months after the non-standard mortgage has <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Balloon payment.
paragraph.content: Balloon payment. For a loan with a term of less than five years, a payment schedule with regular periodic payments that when aggregated do not fully amortize the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exception.
paragraph.content: Exception. The limitations in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-d-1-i" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)</ref> of this section do not apply to loans with maturities of less than one year, if the purpose of the loan is a “bridge” loan connected with the acquisition or construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> intended to become the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-C
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: The first interest rate adjustment to an ARM if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and the new interest rate disclosed at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> pursuant to § <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">1026.20(d)</ref> was not an estimate; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> plan subject to subpart B of this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section, the requirements of this section apply to a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction that is secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, and in which either:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1-i
paragraph.content: The annual percentage rate at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> will exceed by more than 8 percentage points for first-lien loans, or by more than 10 percentage points for subordinate-lien loans, the yield on Treasury securities having comparable periods of maturity to the loan maturity as of the fifteenth day of the month immediately preceding the month in which the application for the extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> is received by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: The total points and fees payable by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> at or before loan closing will exceed the greater of 8 percent of the total loan amount, or $400; the $400 figure shall be adjusted annually on January 1 by the annual percentage change in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index that was reported on the preceding June 1.

paragraph.label: 1026-17-c-1
paragraph.content: The disclosures shall reflect the terms of the legal obligation between the parties.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2
paragraph.content: This section does not apply to the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-24" reftype="term">residential mortgage transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-ii
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">reverse mortgage transaction</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-33" reftype="internal">1026.33</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> plan subject to subpart B of this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalty
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalty —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit transactions.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref> transactions. For a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction, prepayment penalty means a charge imposed for paying all or part of the transaction's principal before the date on which the principal is due, other than a waived, bona fide third-party charge that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> imposes if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> prepays all of the transaction's principal sooner than 36 months after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, provided, however, that interest charged consistent with the monthly interest accrual amortization method is not a prepayment penalty for extensions of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insured by the Federal Housing Administration that are consummated before January 21, 2015.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a
paragraph.title: Prohibited acts or practices for high-cost mortgages.
paragraph.content: Prohibited <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> or practices for high-cost mortgages. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extending mortgage <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref> shall not:

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-1
paragraph.title: Home improvement contracts.
paragraph.content: Home improvement contracts. Pay a contractor under a home improvement contract from the proceeds of a mortgage covered by § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref>, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-1-i
paragraph.content: By an instrument payable to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or jointly to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and the contractor; or

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: At the election of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, through a third-party escrow agent in accordance with terms established in a written agreement signed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, and the contractor prior to the disbursement.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-2
paragraph.title: Notice to assignee.
paragraph.content: Notice to assignee. Sell or otherwise assign a mortgage subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref> without furnishing the following statement to the purchaser or assignee: “Notice: This is a mortgage subject to special rules under the Federal Truth in Lending <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>. Purchasers or assignees of this mortgage could be liable for all claims and defenses with respect to the mortgage that the borrower could assert against the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.”

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-3
paragraph.title: Refinancings within one-year period.
paragraph.content: Refinancings within one-year period. Within one year of having extended <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref>, refinance any loan subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref> to the same borrower into another loan subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref>, unless the refinancing is in the borrower's interest. An assignee holding or servicing an extension of mortgage <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref>, shall not, for the remainder of the one-year period following the date of origination of the <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref>, refinance any loan subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref> to the same borrower into another loan subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref>, unless the refinancing is in the borrower's interest. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> (or assignee) is prohibited from engaging in <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">acts</ref> or practices to evade this provision, including a pattern or practice of arranging for the refinancing of its own loans by affiliated or unaffiliated <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>, or modifying a loan agreement (whether or not the existing loan is satisfied and replaced by the new loan) and charging a fee.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4
paragraph.title: Repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Repayment ability. Extend <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref> to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> based on the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s collateral without regard to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability as of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, including the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current and reasonably expected income, employment, assets other than the collateral, current obligations, and mortgage-related obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-i
paragraph.title: Mortgage-related obligations.
paragraph.content: Mortgage-related obligations. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref>, mortgage-related obligations are expected property taxes, premiums for mortgage-related insurance required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> as set forth in § <ref target="1026-35-b-3-i" reftype="internal">1026.35(b), and </ref>similar expenses.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-ii
paragraph.title: Verification of repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Verification of repayment ability. Under this paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability as follows:

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify amounts of income or assets that it relies on to determine repayment ability, including expected income or assets, by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s Internal Revenue Service Form W-2, tax returns, payroll receipts, financial institution records, or other third-party documents that provide reasonably reliable evidence of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii-A" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(ii)(A)</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has not violated paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(ii)</ref> if the amounts of income and assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relied upon in determining repayment ability are not materially greater than the amounts of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> could have verified pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii-A" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(ii)(A)</ref> at the time the loan was consummated.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-ii-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii
paragraph.title: Presumption of compliance.
paragraph.content: Presumption of compliance. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is presumed to have complied with this paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> with respect to a transaction if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii-A
paragraph.content: Verifies the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(ii)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: Determines the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability using the largest payment of principal and interest scheduled in the first seven years following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and taking into account current obligations and mortgage-related obligations as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-i" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(i)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii-C
paragraph.content: Assesses the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability taking into account at least one of the following: The ratio of total debt obligations to income, or the income the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have after paying debt obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iv
paragraph.title: Exclusions from presumption of compliance.
paragraph.content: Exclusions from presumption of compliance. Notwithstanding the previous paragraph, no presumption of compliance is available for a transaction for which:

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iv-A
paragraph.content: The regular periodic payments for the first seven years would cause the principal balance to increase; or

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iv-B
paragraph.content: The term of the loan is less than seven years and the regular periodic payments when aggregated do not fully amortize the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-v
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. This paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> does not apply to temporary or “bridge” loans with terms of twelve months or less, such as a loan to purchase a new <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> plans to sell a current <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> within twelve months.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-5
paragraph.content: Affiliate means any company that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with another company, as set forth in the Bank Holding Company <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1956 (<ref target="USC:12-1841" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1841</ref> et seq.).

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2
paragraph.content: [Reserved]<ref target="USC:12-1841" reftype="external"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: All <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid directly or indirectly by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, that can be attributed to that transaction at the time the interest rate is set unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, and already has been included in points and fees under paragraph (b)(2)(i) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is an employee of the mortgage broker; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: That <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is paid by a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3
paragraph.title: Bona fide discount point
paragraph.content: Bona fide discount point —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The term bona fide discount point means an amount equal to 1 percent of the loan amount paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> that reduces the interest rate or time-price differential applicable to the transaction based on a calculation that is consistent with established industry practices for determining the amount of reduction in the interest rate or time-price differential appropriate for the amount of discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1
paragraph.content: In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref><ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">d-end cred</ref>it transaction, points and fees means the following fees or charges that are known at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i
paragraph.content: All items included in the finance charge un<ref target="1026-4-a" reftype="internal">der § 102</ref>6.4(a<ref target="1026-4-b" reftype="internal">) and (b)</ref>, except that the following items are excluded:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-A
paragraph.content: Interest or the time-price differential;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-B
paragraph.content: Any premium or other charge imposed in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program for any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C
paragraph.content: For any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss and that is not in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-1
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the entire amount of such premium or other charge; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-2
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the portion of any such premium or other charge that is not in excess of the amount payable under policies in effect at the time of origination under section 203(c)(2)(A) of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1709" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1709</ref>(c)(2)(A)), provided that the premium or charge is required to be refundable on a pro rata basis and the refund is automatically issued upon notification of the satisfaction of the underlying mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-D
paragraph.content: Any bona fide third-party charge not retained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either, unless the charge is required to be included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E
