paragraph.label: 1026-20-d
paragraph.content: Initial rate adjustment. The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer of an adjustable-rate mortgage shall provide <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> with disclosures, as described in this paragraph (d), in c<ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">onn</ref>ection with the initial interest rate adjustment pursuant to the loan contract. To the extent that other provisions of this subpart C govern the disclosures required by this paragraph (d), those provisions apply to assignees and servicers as well as to <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref>. The disclosures required by this paragraph (d) shall be provided as a separate document from other documents provided by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer. The disclosures shall be provided to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> at least 210, but no more than 240, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. If the first payment at the adjusted level is due within the first 210 days after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the disclosures shall be provided at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1
paragraph.title: Coverage.
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> in which the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> do not apply to ARMs with terms of one year or less.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2
paragraph.title: Content.
paragraph.content: Content. If the new interest rate (or the new payment calculated from the new interest rate) is not known as of the date of the disclosure, an estimate shall be disclosed and labeled as such. This estimate shall be based on the calculation of the index reported in the source of information described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section within fifteen business days prior to the date of the disclosure. The disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The date of the disclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and that any change in the interest rate may result in a change in the mortgage payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ix
paragraph.content: The telephone number of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer for <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to call if they anticipate not being able to make their new payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x
paragraph.content: The following alternatives to paying at the new rate that <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> may be able to pursue and a brief explanation of each alternative, expressed in simple and clear terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-C
paragraph.content: Modifying the terms of the loan with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, assignee, or servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-xi
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, the HUD toll-free telephone number to access the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> Web site to access contact information for <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> housing finance authorities (as defined in § 1301 of the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1989).

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3
paragraph.title: Format.
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i
paragraph.content: Except for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-i" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)</ref> of this section shall appear outside of and above the table required in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-2-iii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d-3-i" reftype="internal">(d)(3)(i)</ref> of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms <ref target="1026-H-4(D)(3)" reftype="internal">H-4(D)(3)</ref> and (4) in appendix <ref target="1026-H" reftype="internal">H</ref> to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is not a qualified mortgage unless the transaction's total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref>, do not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-A
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $100,000 (indexed for inflation): 3 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-B
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $60,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $100,000 (indexed for inflation): $3,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-C
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $20,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $60,000 (indexed for inflation): 5 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-D
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> greater than or equal to $12,500 (indexed for inflation) but less than $20,000 (indexed for inflation): $1,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-E
paragraph.content: For a <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> less than $12,500 (indexed for inflation): 8 percent of the total <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage may provide for a balloon payment, provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(ii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-e-2-v" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> determines at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> can make all of the scheduled payments under the terms of the legal obligation, as described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-iv" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(iv)</ref> of this section, together with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payments for all <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref> and excluding the balloon payment, from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income and verifies the debt obligations and income used to determine that ratio in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section, except that the calculation of the payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> for purposes of determining the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations in (c)(7)(i)(A) shall be determined in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref>(iv)(A) of this section, together with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payments for all <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref> and excluding the balloon payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv
paragraph.content: The legal obligation provides for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: Scheduled payments that are substantially equal, calculated using an amortization period that does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: An interest rate that does not increase over the term of the loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> of five years or longer.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v
paragraph.content: The loan is not subject, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, to a commitment to be acquired by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, other than a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> satisfies the requirements stated in § <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-B" reftype="internal">(B)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-a
paragraph.title: General rule.
paragraph.content: General rule. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall retain evidence of compliance with this regulation, other than advertising requirements und<ref target="1026-16" reftype="internal">er §§ 1</ref>026.1<ref target="1026-24" reftype="internal">6 and 1</ref>026.24 and certain requirements for mortgage loans under paragraph (c) of this section, for two years after the date disclosures are required to be made or action is required to be taken. The administrative agencies responsible for enforcing the regulation may require a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> under their jurisdictions to retain records for a longer <ref target="USC:0-0" reftype="external">period </ref>if necessary to carry out their enforcement responsibilities under section 108 of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-b
paragraph.title: Inspection of records.
paragraph.content: Inspection of records. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall permit the agency responsible for enforcing this part with respect to that <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to inspect its relevant records for compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c
paragraph.content: Records related to certain requirements for mortgage loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-1
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2
paragraph.title: Records related to requirements for loan originator compensation.
paragraph.content: Records related to requirements for <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-25-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section, for transactions subject to § <ref target="1026-36" reftype="internal">1026.36</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it pays to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> agreement that governs those payments for three years after the date of payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)(iii)</ref>, shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it receives from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, or another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>; all <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> it pays to any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)(ii)</ref>; and the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> agreement that governs each such receipt or payment, for three years after the date of each such receipt or payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-3
paragraph.title: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a dwelling.
paragraph.content: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-25-a" reftype="internal">(a)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall retain evidence of compliance with § <ref target="1026-43" reftype="internal">1026.43</ref> of this regulation for three years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a transaction covered by that section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. The term non-standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A
paragraph.content: An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, with an introductory fixed interest rate for a period of one year or longer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2
paragraph.title: Explanation of amount due.
paragraph.content: Explanation of amount due. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The monthly payment amount, including a breakdown showing how much, if any, will be applied to principal, interest, and escrow and, if a mortgage loan has multiple payment options, a breakdown of each of the payment options along with information on whether the principal balance will increase, decrease, or stay the same for each option listed;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The total sum of any fees or charges imposed since the last statement; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: Any payment amount past due.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-10
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalty has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)(A)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(ii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-e-2-v" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (HMDA) data for the preceding calendar year, no more than two <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> extended covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, five or more times in the county. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8
paragraph.title: Delinquency information.
paragraph.content: Delinquency information. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is more than 45 days delinquent, the following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement or, alternatively, on a separate page enclosed with the periodic statement or in a separate letter:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-i
paragraph.content: The date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> became delinquent;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-ii
paragraph.content: A notification of possible risks, such as foreclosure, and expenses, that may be incurred if the delinquency is not cured;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iii
paragraph.content: An account history showing, for the previous six months or the period since the last time the account was current, whichever is shorter, the amount remaining past due from each <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref> or, if any such payment was fully paid, the date on which it was credited as fully paid;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-iv
paragraph.content: A notice indicating any loss mitigation program to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has agreed, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-v
paragraph.content: A notice of whether the servicer has made the first notice or filing required by applicable law for any judicial or non-judicial foreclosure process, if applicable;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-vi
paragraph.content: The total payment amount needed to bring the account current; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8-vii
paragraph.content: A reference to the homeownership counselor information disclosed pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-7-v" reftype="internal">(d)(7)(v)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii
paragraph.title: Small servicer defined.
paragraph.content: Small servicer defined. A small servicer is a servicer that either:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: Services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, for all of which the servicer (or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref>) is the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a Housing Finance Agency, as defined in <ref target="CFR:24-266-5" reftype="external">24 CFR 266.5</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a
paragraph.title: Mortgage transactions subject to RESPA
paragraph.content: Mortgage transactions subject to RESPA —

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-i
paragraph.title: Time of disclosures.
paragraph.content: Time of disclosures. In a mortgage transaction subject to the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.) that is secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, other than a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref> or mortgage transaction subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-5" reftype="internal">(a)(5)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make good faith estimates of the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref> and shall deliver or place them in the mail not later than the third business day after the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-ii
paragraph.title: Imposition of fees.
paragraph.content: Imposition of fees. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-iii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(iii)</ref> of this section, neither a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor any other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may impose a fee on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application for a mortgage transaction subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has received the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section. If the disclosures are mailed to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is considered to have received them three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> after they are mailed.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-iii
paragraph.title: Exception to fee restriction.
paragraph.content: Exception to fee restriction. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may impose a fee for obtaining the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> history before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has received the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, provided the fee is bona fide and reasonable in amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2
paragraph.title: Waiting periods for early disclosures and corrected disclosures.
paragraph.content: Waiting periods for early disclosures and corrected disclosures.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall deliver or place in the mail the good faith estimates required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section not later than the seventh <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business day</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the annual percentage rate disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section becomes inaccurate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-22" reftype="internal">1026.22</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall provide corrected disclosures with all changed terms. The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must receive the corrected disclosures no later than three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>. If the corrected disclosures are mailed to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or delivered to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> by means other than delivery in <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is deemed to have received the corrected disclosures three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> after they are mailed or delivered.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-3
paragraph.title: Consumer's waiver of waiting period before consummation.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref>'s waiver of waiting period before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> determines that the extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> is needed to meet a bona fide personal financial emergency, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may modify or waive the seven-business-day waiting period or the three-business-day waiting period required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section, after receiving the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref>. To modify or waive a waiting period, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> shall give the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> a dated written statement that describes the emergency, specifically modifies or waives the waiting period, and bears the signature of all the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> who are primarily liable on the legal obligation. Printed forms for this purpose are prohibited.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-4
paragraph.title: Notice.
paragraph.content: Notice. Disclosures made pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> or paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section shall contain the following statement: “You are not required to complete this agreement merely because you have received these disclosures or signed a loan application.” The disclosure required by this paragraph shall be grouped together with the disclosures required by paragraphs <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> or <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5
paragraph.title: Timeshare plans.
paragraph.content: Timeshare plans. In a mortgage transaction subject to the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.) that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan described in <ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">11 U.S.C. 101</ref>(53(D)):

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-i
paragraph.content: The requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> through <ref target="1026-19-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> of this section do not apply;

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make good faith estimates of the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, or shall deliver or place them in the mail not later than three business days after the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application, whichever is earlier; and

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-iii
paragraph.content: If the annual percentage rate at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> varies from the annual percentage rate disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-5-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(5)(ii)</ref> of this section by more than 1/8 of 1 percentage point in a regular transaction or more than 1/4 of 1 percentage point in an irregular transaction, as defined in § <ref target="1026-22" reftype="internal">1026.22</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall disclose all the changed terms no later than <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> or settlement.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b
paragraph.title: Certain variable-rate transactions.
paragraph.content: Certain variable-rate transactions. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section, if the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> in a transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with a term greater than one year, the following disclosures must be provided at the time an application form is provided or before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> pays a non-refundable fee, whichever is earlier (except that the disclosures may be delivered or placed in the mail not later than three business days following receipt of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application when the application reaches the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by telephone, or through an intermediary agent or broker):

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-1
paragraph.content: The booklet titled <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Handbook on Adjustable Rate Mortgages, or a suitable substitute.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2
paragraph.content: A loan program disclosure for each variable-rate program in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> expresses an interest. The following disclosures, as applicable, shall be provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-i
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate, payment, or term of the loan can change.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: The index or formula used in making adjustments, and a source of information about the index or formula.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate and payment will be determined, including an explanation of how the index is adjusted, such as by the addition of a margin.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: A statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the current margin value and current interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-v
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate will be discounted, and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the amount of the interest rate discount.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vi
paragraph.content: The frequency of interest rate and payment changes.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vii
paragraph.content: Any rules relating to changes in the index, interest rate, payment amount, and outstanding loan balance including, for example, an explanation of interest rate or payment limitations, negative amortization, and interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii
paragraph.content: At the option of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, either of the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-A
paragraph.content: A historical example, based on a $10,000 loan amount, illustrating how payments and the loan balance would have been affected by interest rate changes implemented according to the terms of the loan program disclosure. The example shall reflect the most recent 15 years of index values. The example shall reflect all significant loan program terms, such as negative amortization, interest rate carryover, interest rate discounts, and interest rate and payment limitations, that would have been affected by the index movement during the period.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-B
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate and payment for a $10,000 loan originated at the initial interest rate (index value plus margin, adjusted by the amount of any discount or premium) in effect as of an identified month and year for the loan program disclosure assuming the maximum periodic increases in rates and payments under the program; and the initial interest rate and payment for that loan and a statement that the periodic payment may increase or decrease substantially depending on changes in the rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may calculate the payments for the loan amount to be borrowed based on either:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-A
paragraph.content: The most recent payment shown in the historical example in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(A)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-B
paragraph.content: The initial interest rate used to calculate the maximum interest rate and payment in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-B" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(B)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-x
paragraph.content: The fact that the loan program contains a demand feature.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xi
paragraph.content: The type of information that will be provided in notices of adjustments and the timing of such notices.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xii
paragraph.content: A statement that disclosure forms are available for the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s other variable-rate loan programs.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-c
paragraph.title: Electronic disclosures.
paragraph.content: Electronic disclosures. For an application that is accessed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form, the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">(b)</ref> of this section may be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form on or with the application.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-d
paragraph.content: Information provided in accordance with variable-rate regulations of other Federal agencies may be substituted for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">(b)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-v" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, an escrow account need not be established for a transaction if, at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties that are either “rural” or “underserved,” as set forth in paragraph (b)(2)(iv) of th<ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">is section</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v
paragraph.content: The loan is not subject, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, to a commitment to be acquired by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, other than a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3
paragraph.title: Past Payment Breakdown.
paragraph.content: Past Payment Breakdown. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the last statement, including a breakdown showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, sent to any suspense or unapplied funds account; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The total of all payments received since the beginning of the current calendar year, including a breakdown of that total showing the amount, if any, that was applied to principal, interest, escrow, fees and charges, and the amount, if any, currently held in any suspense or unapplied funds account.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b
paragraph.title: Certain variable-rate transactions.
paragraph.content: Certain variable-rate transactions. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section, if the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> in a transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with a term greater than one year, the following disclosures must be provided at the time an application form is provided or before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> pays a non-refundable fee, whichever is earlier (except that the disclosures may be delivered or placed in the mail not later than three business days following receipt of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application when the application reaches the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by telephone, or through an intermediary agent or broker):

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-1
paragraph.content: The booklet titled <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Handbook on Adjustable Rate Mortgages, or a suitable substitute.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2
paragraph.content: A loan program disclosure for each variable-rate program in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> expresses an interest. The following disclosures, as applicable, shall be provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-i
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate, payment, or term of the loan can change.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: The index or formula used in making adjustments, and a source of information about the index or formula.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate and payment will be determined, including an explanation of how the index is adjusted, such as by the addition of a margin.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: A statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the current margin value and current interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-v
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate will be discounted, and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the amount of the interest rate discount.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vi
paragraph.content: The frequency of interest rate and payment changes.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vii
paragraph.content: Any rules relating to changes in the index, interest rate, payment amount, and outstanding loan balance including, for example, an explanation of interest rate or payment limitations, negative amortization, and interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii
paragraph.content: At the option of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, either of the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-A
paragraph.content: A historical example, based on a $10,000 loan amount, illustrating how payments and the loan balance would have been affected by interest rate changes implemented according to the terms of the loan program disclosure. The example shall reflect the most recent 15 years of index values. The example shall reflect all significant loan program terms, such as negative amortization, interest rate carryover, interest rate discounts, and interest rate and payment limitations, that would have been affected by the index movement during the period.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-B
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate and payment for a $10,000 loan originated at the initial interest rate (index value plus margin, adjusted by the amount of any discount or premium) in effect as of an identified month and year for the loan program disclosure assuming the maximum periodic increases in rates and payments under the program; and the initial interest rate and payment for that loan and a statement that the periodic payment may increase or decrease substantially depending on changes in the rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may calculate the payments for the loan amount to be borrowed based on either:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-A
paragraph.content: The most recent payment shown in the historical example in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(A)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-B
paragraph.content: The initial interest rate used to calculate the maximum interest rate and payment in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-B" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(B)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-x
paragraph.content: The fact that the loan program contains a demand feature.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xi
paragraph.content: The type of information that will be provided in notices of adjustments and the timing of such notices.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xii
paragraph.content: A statement that disclosure forms are available for the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s other variable-rate loan programs.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1
paragraph.title: Amount due.
paragraph.content: Amount due. Grouped together in close proximity to each other and located at the top of the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-i
paragraph.content: The payment due date;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: The amount of any late payment fee, and the date on which that fee will be imposed if payment has not been received; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: The amount due, shown more prominently than other disclosures on the page and, if the transaction has multiple payment options, the amount due under each of the payment options.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-6
paragraph.title: Contact information.
paragraph.content: Contact information. A toll-free telephone number and, if applicable, an electronic mailing address that may be used by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to obtain information about the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s account, located on the front page of the statement.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7
paragraph.title: Account information.
paragraph.content: Account information. The following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-i
paragraph.content: The amount of the outstanding principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-ii
paragraph.content: The current interest rate in effect for the mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-iii
paragraph.content: The date after which the interest rate may next change;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-iv
paragraph.content: The existence of any prepayment penalty, as defined in § <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(6)(i)</ref>, that may be charged;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-7-v
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations and the HUD toll-free telephone number to access contact information for homeownership counselors or counseling organizations; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-4
paragraph.title: Transaction activity.
paragraph.content: Transaction activity. A list of all the transaction activity that occurred since the last statement. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-41-d-4" reftype="internal">(d)(4)</ref>, transaction activity means any activity that causes a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> or debit to the amount currently due. This list must include the date of the transaction, a brief description of the transaction, and the amount of the transaction for each activity on the list.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-5
paragraph.title: Partial payment information.
paragraph.content: Partial payment information. If a statement reflects a partial payment that was placed in a suspense or unapplied funds account, information explaining what must be done for the funds to be applied. The information must be on the front page of the statement or, alternatively, may be included on a separate page enclosed with the periodic statement or in a separate letter.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a
paragraph.title: Loan originator and mortgage broker defined
paragraph.content: Definitions.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1
paragraph.title: Loan originator.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">Loan originator</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of this section, the term “loan originator” means a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who, in expectation of direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> or other monetary gain or for direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> or other monetary gain, performs any of the following activities: takes an application, offers, arranges, assists a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in obtaining or applying to obtain, negotiates, or otherwise obtains or makes an extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> for another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>; or through advertising or other means of communication represents to the public that such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> can or will perform any of these activities. The term “loan originator” includes an employee, agent, or contractor of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> if the employee, agent, or contractor meets this definition. The term “loan originator” includes a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that engages in loan origination activities if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> does not finance the transaction at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> out of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s own resources, including by drawing on a bona fide warehouse line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> or out of deposits held by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>. All <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> that engage in any of the foregoing loan origination activities are loan originators for purposes of paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> and <ref target="1026-36-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> of this section. The term does not include:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who does not take a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> application or offer or negotiate <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, but who performs purely administrative or clerical tasks on behalf of a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who does engage in such activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An employee of a manufactured home retailer who does not take a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> application, offer or negotiate <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, or advise a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms (including rates, fees, and other costs) available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that performs only real estate brokerage activities and is licensed or registered in accordance with applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law, unless such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> is compensated by a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> or by any agent of such <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for a particular <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction subject to this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-D
paragraph.content: A seller financer that meets the criteria in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-5" reftype="internal">(a)(5)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-E
paragraph.content: A servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate terms for purposes of renegotiating, modifying, replacing, or subordinating principal of existing mortgages where <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> are behind in their payments, in default, or have a reasonable likelihood of defaulting or falling behind. This exception does not apply, however, to a servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate a transaction that constitutes a refinancing under § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref> or obligates a different <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on the existing debt.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: An “individual loan originator” is a natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who meets the definition of “loan originator” in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: A “loan originator organization” is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, that is not an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-2
paragraph.title: Mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Mortgage broker. For purposes of this section, a mortgage broker with respect to a particular transaction is any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is not an employee of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-3
paragraph.title: Compensation.
paragraph.content: Compensation. The term “compensation” includes salaries, commissions, and any financial or similar incentive.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4
paragraph.title: Seller financers; three properties.
paragraph.content: Seller financers; three properties. A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> (as defined in § <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(22)</ref>) that meets all of the following criteria is not a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> provides seller financing for the sale of three or fewer properties in any 12-month period to purchasers of such properties, each of which is owned by the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> and serves as security for the financing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has not constructed, or acted as a contractor for the construction of, a residence on the property in the ordinary course of business of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> provides seller financing that meets the following requirements:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-A
paragraph.content: The financing is fully amortizing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: The financing is one that the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> determines in good faith the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has a reasonable ability to repay.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-4-iii-C
paragraph.content: The financing has a fixed rate or an adjustable rate that is adjustable after five or more years, subject to reasonable annual and lifetime limitations on interest rate increases. If the financing agreement has an adjustable rate, the rate is determined by the addition of a margin to an index rate and is subject to reasonable rate adjustment limitations. The index the adjustable rate is based on is a widely available index such as indices for U.S. Treasury securities or LIBOR.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5
paragraph.title: Seller financers; one property.
paragraph.content: Seller financers; one property. A natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust that meets all of the following criteria is not a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> under paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-i
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust provides seller financing for the sale of only one property in any 12-month period to purchasers of such property, which is owned by the natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust and serves as security for the financing.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-ii
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust has not constructed, or acted as a contractor for the construction of, a residence on the property in the ordinary course of business of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii
paragraph.content: The natural <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, estate, or trust provides seller financing that meets the following requirements:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii-A
paragraph.content: The financing has a repayment schedule that does not result in negative amortization.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-5-iii-B
paragraph.content: The financing has a fixed rate or an adjustable rate that is adjustable after five or more years, subject to reasonable annual and lifetime limitations on interest rate increases. If the financing agreement has an adjustable rate, the rate is determined by the addition of a margin to an index rate and is subject to reasonable rate adjustment limitations. The index the adjustable rate is based on is a widely available index such as indices for U.S. Treasury securities or LIBOR.

paragraph.label: 1026-17-b
paragraph.title: Time of disclosures.
paragraph.content: Time of disclosures. The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make disclosures before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the transaction. In certain <ref target="1026-2-a-24" reftype="term">residential mortgage transactions</ref>, special timing requirements are set forth in § <ref target="1026-19-a" reftype="internal">1026.19(a)</ref>. In certain variable-rate transactions, special timing requirements for variable-rate disclosures are set forth in § <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">1026.19(b)</ref> and § <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">1026.20(c)</ref> and (d). For private education loan disclosures made in compliance<ref target="1026-47" reftype="internal"> with §</ref> 1026.47, special timing requirements are set for<ref target="1026-46-d" reftype="internal">th in § 10</ref>26.46(d). In certain transactions involving mail or telephone orders or a series of sales, the timing of disclosures may be delayed in accordance with par<ref target="1026-17-g" reftype="internal">agr</ref>aphs <ref target="1026-17-h" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> and (h) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-b
paragraph.content: Scope. Paragraph (c) of this section applies to closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Paragraphs (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (i) of this section apply to closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transactions secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. This section does not apply to a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § 1026.40, except that paragraphs (h) and (i) of this section apply to such <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> when secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>. Paragraphs (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (i) of this section do not apply to a loan that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan described in 11 U.S.C. 101(53D).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d
paragraph.title: Prohibited payments to loan originators
paragraph.content: Prohibited payments to <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originators</ref> —

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1
paragraph.title: Payments based on transaction terms or conditions.
paragraph.content: Payments based on a term of a transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-i
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph (d)(1)(iii) or (iv) of this section, in connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, no <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive and no <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> shall pay to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in an amount that is based on a term of a transaction, the terms of multiple transactions by an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, or the terms of multiple transactions by multiple <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originators</ref>. If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based in whole or in part on a factor that is a proxy for a term of a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based on a term of a transaction. A factor that is not itself a term of a transaction is a proxy for a term of the transaction if the factor consistently varies with that term over a significant number of transactions, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> has the ability, directly or indirectly, to add, drop, or change the factor in originating the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> only, a “term of a transaction” is any right or obligation of the parties to a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> transaction. The amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended is not a term of a transaction or a proxy for a term of a transaction, provided that <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> received by or paid to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, is based on a fixed percentage of the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended; however, such <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> may be subject to a minimum or maximum dollar amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">oan or</ref>iginator may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-2" reftype="internal">dual l</ref>oan originator, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in the form of a contribution to a defined contribution plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan or a benefit under a defined benefit plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan. In the case of a contribution to a defined contribution plan, the contribution shall not be directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions. As used in this paragraph (d)(1)(iii), “designated tax-advantaged plan” means any plan that meets the requirements of Internal Revenue Code section 401(a), 26 U.S.C. 401(a); employee annuity plan described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(a), 26 U.S.C. 403(a); simple retirement account, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 408(p), 26 U.S.C. 408(p); simplified employee pension described in Internal Revenue Code section 408(k), 26 U.S.C. 408(k); annuity contract described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(b), 26 U.S.C. 403(b); or eligible deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 457(b), 26 U.S.C. 457(b).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under a non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan (i.e., any arrangement for the payment of non-deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> that is determined with reference to the profits of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> from mortgage-related business), provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: At least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> was a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for ten or fewer transactions subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> consummated during the 12-month period preceding the date of the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> determination.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2
paragraph.title: Payments by persons other than consumer.
paragraph.content: Payments by <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">persons</ref> other than <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i
paragraph.content: Dual <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-2-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, if any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-1
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>, directly or indirectly, from any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-2
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who knows or has reason to know of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>-paid <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> (other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>) shall pay any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, in connection with the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-B
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">Compensation</ref> received directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> includes payments to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> made pursuant to an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref>, under which such other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> agrees to provide funds toward the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s costs of the transaction (including <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-C
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> may pay <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: Exemption. A payment to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is otherwise prohibited by section 129B(c)(2)(A) of the Truth in Lending <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> is nevertheless permitted pursuant to section 129B(c)(2)(B) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, regardless of whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes any upfront payment of discount points, origination points, or fees, as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, as long as the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> does not receive any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(i) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-3
paragraph.title: Affiliates.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">Affiliates</ref>. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> shall be treated as a single “<ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.”

paragraph.label: 1026-H-4(A)-h1
paragraph.title: Example based on the specific transaction

paragraph.label: 1026-H-4(A)-h1-p22
