paragraph.content: Unemployment income must be documented for two years, and there must be reasonable assurance that this income will continue. This requirement may apply to seasonal employment.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-4
paragraph.title: Mortgage Credit Certificates.
paragraph.content: Mortgage <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> Certificates.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-4-a
paragraph.content: If a government entity subsidizes the mortgage payments either through direct payments or tax rebates, these payments may be considered as acceptable income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-4-b
paragraph.content: Either type of subsidy may be added to gross income, or used directly to offset the mortgage payment, before calculating the qualifying ratios.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5
paragraph.title: Homeownership Subsidies.
paragraph.content: Homeownership Subsidies.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-a
paragraph.content: A monthly subsidy may be treated as income, if a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is receiving subsidies under the housing choice voucher home ownership option from a public housing agency (PHA). Although continuation of the homeownership voucher subsidy beyond the first year is subject to Congressional appropriation, for the purposes of underwriting, the subsidy will be assumed to continue for at least three years.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-b
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is receiving the subsidy directly, the amount received is treated as income. The amount received may also be treated as nontaxable income and be “grossed up” by 25 percent, which means that the amount of the subsidy, plus 25 percent of that subsidy may be added to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income from employment and/or other sources.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-c
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditors</ref> may treat this subsidy as an “offset” to the monthly mortgage payment (that is, reduce the monthly mortgage payment by the amount of the home ownership assistance payment before dividing by the monthly income to determine the payment-to-income and debt-to-income ratios). The subsidy payment must not pass through the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s hands.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-d
paragraph.content: The assistance payment must be:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-d-i
paragraph.content: Paid directly to the servicing <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-d-ii
paragraph.content: Placed in an account that only the servicing <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may access.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-d-p17
paragraph.content: ```note Note:Assistance payments made directly to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must be treated as income. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D
paragraph.content: Rental Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-1
paragraph.title: Analyzing the Stability of Rental Income.
paragraph.content: Analyzing the Stability of Rental Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-1-a
paragraph.content: Rent received for properties owned by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is acceptable as long as the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> can document the stability of the rental income through:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-1-a-i
paragraph.content: A current lease;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-1-a-ii
paragraph.content: An agreement to lease, or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-1-a-iii
paragraph.content: A rental history over the previous 24 months that is free of unexplained gaps greater than three months (such gaps could be explained by student, seasonal, or military renters, or property rehabilitation).

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-1-b
paragraph.content: A separate schedule of real estate is not required for rental properties as long as all properties are documented on the Uniform Residential Loan Application.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-1-p18
paragraph.content: ```note Note:The underwriting analysis may not consider rental income from any property being vacated by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, except under the circumstances described below. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-2
paragraph.title: Rental Income From Consumer Occupied Property.
paragraph.content: Rental Income From <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Occupied Property.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-2-a
paragraph.content: The rent for multiple unit property where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> resides in one or more units and charges rent to tenants of other units may be used for qualifying purposes.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-2-b
paragraph.content: Projected rent for the tenant-occupied units only may:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-2-b-i
paragraph.content: Be considered gross income, only after deducting vacancy and maintenance factors, and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-2-b-ii
paragraph.content: Not be used as a direct offset to the mortgage payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-3
paragraph.title: Income from Roommates in a Single Family Property.
paragraph.content: Income from Roommates in a Single Family Property.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-3-a
paragraph.content: Income from roommates in a single family property occupied as the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s primary residence is not acceptable. Rental income from boarders however, is acceptable, if the boarders are related by blood, marriage, or law.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-3-b
paragraph.content: The rental income may be considered effective, if shown on the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s tax return. If not on the tax return, rental income paid by the boarder may not be used in qualifying.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-4
paragraph.title: Documentation Required To Verify Rental Income.
paragraph.content: Documentation Required To Verify Rental Income. Analysis of the following required documentation is necessary to verify all <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> rental income:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-4-a
paragraph.content: IRS Form 1040 Schedule E; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-4-b
paragraph.content: Current leases/rental agreements.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-5
paragraph.title: Analyzing IRS Form 1040 Schedule E.
paragraph.content: Analyzing IRS Form 1040 Schedule E.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-5-a
paragraph.content: The IRS Form 1040 Schedule E is required to verify all rental income. Depreciation shown on Schedule E may be added back to the net income or loss.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-5-b
paragraph.content: Positive rental income is considered gross income for qualifying purposes, while negative income must be treated as a recurring liability.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-5-c
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must confirm that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> still owns each property listed, by comparing Schedule E with the real estate owned section of the URLA.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-6
paragraph.title: Using Current Leases To Analyze Rental Income.
paragraph.content: Using Current Leases To Analyze Rental Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-6-a
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> can provide a current signed lease or other rental agreement for a property that was acquired since the last income tax filing, and is not shown on Schedule E.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-6-b
paragraph.content: In order to calculate the rental income:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-6-b-i
paragraph.content: Reduce the gross rental amount by 25 percent for vacancies and maintenance;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-6-b-ii
paragraph.content: Subtract PITI and any homeowners association dues; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-6-b-iii
paragraph.content: Apply the resulting amount to income, if positive, or recurring debts, if negative.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-7
paragraph.title: Exclusion of Rental Income From Property Being Vacated by the Consumer.
paragraph.content: Exclusion of Rental Income From Property Being Vacated by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref>. Underwriters may not consider any rental income from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal residence that is being vacated in favor of another principal residence, except under the conditions described below:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-8
paragraph.title: Policy Exceptions Regarding the Exclusion of Rental Income From a Principal Residence Being Vacated by a Consumer.
paragraph.content: Policy Exceptions Regarding the Exclusion of Rental Income From a Principal Residence Being Vacated by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-p19
paragraph.content: ```note Notes: i. This policy assures that a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> either has sufficient income to make both mortgage payments without any rentalincome, or has an equity position not likely to result in defaulting on the mortgage on the property being vacated. ii. This applies solely to a principal residence being vacated in favor of another principal residence. It does not apply to existing rental properties disclosed on the loan application and confirmed by tax returns (Schedule E of form IRS 1040). ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-D-p20
paragraph.content: When a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> vacates a principal residence in favor of another principal residence, the rental income, reduced by the appropriate vacancy factor, may be considered in the underwriting analysis under the circumstances listed in the table below.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E
paragraph.content: Non Taxable and Projected Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-1
paragraph.title: Types of Non Taxable Income.
paragraph.content: Types of Non Taxable Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-2
paragraph.title: Adding Non Taxable Income to a Consumer's Gross Income.
paragraph.content: Adding Non Taxable Income to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref>'s Gross Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-2-a
paragraph.content: The amount of continuing tax savings attributed to regular income not subject to Federal taxes may be added to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s gross income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-2-b
paragraph.content: The percentage of non-taxable income that may be added cannot exceed the appropriate tax rate for the income amount. Additional allowances for dependents are not acceptable.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-2-c
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-2-c-i
paragraph.content: Must document and support the amount of income grossed up for any non-taxable income source, and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-2-c-ii
paragraph.content: Should use the tax rate used to calculate the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s last year's income tax.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-2-c-p23
paragraph.content: ```note Note: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is not required to file a Federal tax return, the tax rate to use is 25 percent. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-3
paragraph.title: Analyzing Projected Income.
paragraph.content: Analyzing Projected Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-3-a
paragraph.content: Projected or hypothetical income is not acceptable for qualifying purposes. However, exceptions are permitted for income from the following sources:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-3-a-i
paragraph.content: Cost-of-living adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-3-a-ii
paragraph.content: Performance raises; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-3-a-iii
paragraph.content: Bonuses.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-3-b
paragraph.content: For the above exceptions to apply, the income must be:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-3-b-i
paragraph.content: Verified in writing by the employer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-3-b-ii
paragraph.content: Scheduled to begin within 60 days of loan closing.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-4
paragraph.title: Project Income for New Job.
paragraph.content: Project Income for New Job.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-4-a
paragraph.content: Projected income is acceptable for qualifying purposes for a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> scheduled to start a new job within 60 days of loan closing if there is a guaranteed, non-revocable contract for employment.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-4-b
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have sufficient income or cash reserves to support the mortgage payment and any other obligations between loan closing and the start of employment. Examples of this type of scenario are teachers whose contracts begin with the new school year, or physicians beginning a residency after the loan closes fall under this category.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-4-c
paragraph.content: The loan is not eligible for endorsement if the loan closes more than 60 days before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> starts the new job. To be eligible for endorsement, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must obtain from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a pay stub or other acceptable evidence indicating that he/she has started the new job.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-p22
paragraph.content: Certain types of regular income may not be subject to Federal tax. Such types of nontaxable income include:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-p22-a
paragraph.content: Some portion of Social Security, some Federal government employee retirement income, Railroad Retirement Benefits, and some <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> government retirement income:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-p22-b
paragraph.content: Certain types of disability and public assistance payments;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-p22-c
paragraph.content: Child support;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-p22-d
paragraph.content: Military allowances; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-E-p22-e
paragraph.content: Other income that is documented as being exempt from Federal income taxes.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-1
paragraph.title: Types of Recurring Obligation.
paragraph.content: Types of Recurring Obligation. Recurring obligations include:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-1-a
paragraph.content: All installment loans;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-1-b
paragraph.content: Revolving charge accounts;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-1-c
paragraph.content: Real estate loans;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-1-d
paragraph.content: Alimony;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-1-e
paragraph.content: Child support; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-1-f
paragraph.content: Other continuing obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2
paragraph.title: Debt to Income Ratio Computation for Recurring Obligations.
paragraph.content: Debt to Income Ratio Computation for Recurring Obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-a
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must include the following when computing the debt to income ratios for recurring obligations:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-a-i
paragraph.content: Monthly housing expense; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-a-ii
paragraph.content: Additional recurring charges extending ten months or more, such as

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-a-ii-a
paragraph.content: Payments on installment accounts;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-a-ii-b
paragraph.content: Child support or separate maintenance payments;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-a-ii-c
paragraph.content: Revolving accounts; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-a-ii-d
paragraph.content: Alimony.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-b
paragraph.content: Debts lasting less than ten months must be included if the amount of the debt affects the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s ability to pay the mortgage during the months immediately after loan closing, especially if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have limited or no cash assets after loan closing.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-2-p24
paragraph.content: ```note Note:Monthly payments on revolving or open-ended accounts, regardless of the balance, are counted as a liability for qualifying purposes even if the account appears likely to be paid off within 10 months or less. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-3
paragraph.title: Revolving Account Monthly Payment Calculation.
paragraph.content: Revolving Account Monthly Payment Calculation. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report shows any revolving accounts with an outstanding balance but no specific minimum monthly payment, the payment must be calculated as the greater of:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-3-a
paragraph.content: 5 percent of the balance; or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-3-p25
paragraph.content: ```note Note: If the actual monthly payment is documented from the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> obtains a copy of the current statement reflecting the monthly payment, that amount may be used for qualifying purposes. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h3-4
paragraph.title: Reduction of Alimony Payment for Qualifying Ratio Calculation.
paragraph.content: Reduction of Alimony Payment for Qualifying Ratio Calculation. Since there are tax consequences of alimony payments, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may choose to treat the monthly alimony obligation as a reduction from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s gross income when calculating qualifying ratios, rather than treating it as a monthly obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-1
paragraph.title: Definition: Contingent Liability.
paragraph.content: Definition: Contingent Liability. A contingent liability exists when an individual is held responsible for payment of a debt if another party, jointly or severally obligated, defaults on the payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-2
paragraph.title: Application of Contingent Liability Policies.
paragraph.content: Application of Contingent Liability Policies. The contingent liability policies described in this topic apply unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> can provide conclusive evidence from the debt holder that there is no possibility that the debt holder will pursue debt collection against him/her should the other party default.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-3
paragraph.title: Contingent Liability on Mortgage Assumptions.
paragraph.content: Contingent Liability on Mortgage Assumptions. Contingent liability must be considered when the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> remains obligated on an outstanding FHA-insured, VA-guaranteed, or conventional mortgage secured by property that:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-3-a
paragraph.content: Has been sold or traded within the last 12 months without a release of liability, or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-3-b
paragraph.content: Is to be sold on assumption without a release of liability being obtained.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-4
paragraph.title: Exemption From Contingent Liability Policy on Mortgage Assumptions.
paragraph.content: Exemption From Contingent Liability Policy on Mortgage Assumptions. When a mortgage is assumed, contingent liabilities need not be considered if the:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-4-a
paragraph.content: Originating <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> of the mortgage being underwritten obtains, from the servicer of the assumed loan, a payment history showing that the mortgage has been current during the previous 12 months, or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-4-b
paragraph.content: Value of the property, as established by an appraisal or the sales price on the HUD-1 Settlement Statement from the sale of the property, results in a loan-to-value (LTV) ratio of 75 percent or less.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-5
paragraph.title: Contingent Liability on Cosigned Obligations.
paragraph.content: Contingent Liability on Cosigned Obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-5-a
paragraph.content: Contingent liability applies, and the debt must be included in the underwriting analysis, if an individual applying for a mortgage is a cosigner/co-obligor on:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-5-a-i
paragraph.content: A car loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-5-a-ii
paragraph.content: A student loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-5-a-iii
paragraph.content: A mortgage; or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-5-a-iv
paragraph.content: Any other obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h4-5-b
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> obtains documented proof that the primary obligor has been making regular payments during the previous 12 months, and does not have a history of delinquent payments on the loan during that time, the payment does not have to be included in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly obligations.

appendixSection.label: 1026-Q-h5
appendixSection.subject: V. Consumer Liabilities: Projected Obligations and Obligations Not Considered Debt

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-1
paragraph.title: Projected Obligations.
paragraph.content: Projected Obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-1-a
paragraph.content: Debt payments, such as a student loan or balloon-payment note scheduled to begin or come due within 12 months of the mortgage loan closing, must be included by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> as anticipated monthly obligations during the underwriting analysis.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-1-b
paragraph.content: Debt payments do not have to be classified as projected obligations if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> provides written evidence that the debt will be deferred to a period outside the 12-month timeframe.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-1-c
paragraph.content: Balloon-payment notes that come due within one year of loan closing must be considered in the underwriting analysis.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2
paragraph.title: Obligations Not Considered Debt.
paragraph.content: Obligations Not Considered Debt. Obligations not considered debt, and therefore not subtracted from gross income, include:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2-a
paragraph.content: Federal, <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref>, and local taxes;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2-b
paragraph.content: Federal Insurance Contributions <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (FICA) or other retirement contributions, such as 401(k) accounts (including repayment of debt secured by these funds):

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2-c
paragraph.content: Commuting costs;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2-d
paragraph.content: Union dues;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2-e
paragraph.content: Open accounts with zero balances;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2-f
paragraph.content: Automatic deductions to savings accounts;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2-g
paragraph.content: Child care; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h5-2-h
paragraph.content: Voluntary deductions.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-p1-p1
paragraph.content: Section 1026.43(e)(2)(vi) provides that, to satisfy the requirements for a qualified mortgage under § 1026.43(e)(2), the ratio of the consumer's total monthly debt to total monthly income at the time of consummation cannot exceed 43 percent. Section 1026.43(e)(2)(vi)(A) requires the creditor to calculate the ratio of the consumer's total monthly debt to total monthly income using the following standards, with additional requirements for calculating debt and income appearing in § 1026.43(e)(2)(vi)(B).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—small creditor portfolio loans.
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—small <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> portfolio loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i-A
paragraph.content: That satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section other than the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-vi" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(vi)</ref> and without regard to the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i-B
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income and verifies the debt obligations and income used to determine that ratio in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section, except that the calculation of the payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> for purposes of determining the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt obligations in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7-i-A" reftype="internal">(c)(7)(i)(A)</ref> shall be determined in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section instead of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i-C
paragraph.content: That is not subject, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, to a commitment to be acquired by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, other than a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-5-i-D" reftype="internal">(e)(5)(i)(D)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i-D
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> satisfies the requirements stated in § <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-B" reftype="internal">1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(B)</ref> and <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii
paragraph.content: A qualified mortgage extended pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-5-i" reftype="internal">(e)(5)(i)</ref> of this section immediately loses its status as a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-5-i" reftype="internal">(e)(5)(i)</ref> if legal title to the qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> except when:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: The qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> three years or more after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the qualified mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: The qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-5-i-D" reftype="internal">(e)(5)(i)(D)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: The qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> pursuant to a capital restoration plan or other action under <ref target="USC:12-1831" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1831</ref>o, actions or instructions of any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> acting as conservator, receiver, or bankruptcy trustee, an order of a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal government agency with jurisdiction to examine the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> pursuant to <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law, or an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and such an agency; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii-D
paragraph.content: The qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred pursuant to a merger of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> with another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or acquisition of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or of another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—special rules
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—special rules —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i
paragraph.title: General.
paragraph.content: General. Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that satisfies:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i-A
paragraph.content: The requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)</ref> through <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i-B
paragraph.content: One or more of the criteria in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(4)(ii)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii
paragraph.title: Eligible loans.
paragraph.content: Eligible loans. A qualified mortgage under this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref> must be one of the following at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: To be purchased or guaranteed by the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation operating under the conservatorship or receivership of the Federal Housing Finance Agency pursuant to section 1367(a) of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992 (<ref target="USC:12-4617" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 4617</ref>(a)); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: To be purchased or guaranteed by any limited-life regulatory entity succeeding the charter of either the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation pursuant to section 1367(i) of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992 (<ref target="USC:12-4617" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 4617</ref>(i));

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be insured by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development under the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1707" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1707</ref> et seq.);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-C
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-D
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed by the U.S. Department of Agriculture pursuant to <ref target="USC:42-1472" reftype="external">42 U.S.C. 1472</ref>(h); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-E
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be insured by the Rural Housing Service.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii
paragraph.title: Sunset of special rules.
paragraph.content: Sunset of special rules.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii-A
paragraph.content: Each respective special rule described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii-B" reftype="internal">(e)(4)(ii)(B)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii-D" reftype="internal">(D)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-e-4-ii-E" reftype="internal">(E)</ref> of this section shall expire on the effective date of a rule issued by each respective agency pursuant to its authority under TILA section 129C(b)(3)(ii) to define a qualified mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: Unless otherwise expired under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4-iii-A" reftype="internal">(e)(4)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section, the special rules in this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref> are available only for <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transactions</ref> consummated on or before January 10, 2021.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1
paragraph.title: Safe harbor and presumption of compliance—
paragraph.content: Safe harbor and presumption of compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-i
paragraph.title: Safe harbor for transactions that are not higher-priced covered transactions.
paragraph.content: Safe harbor for loans that are not <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transactions</ref>. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee of a qualified mortgage, as defined in paragraphs (e)(2),<ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal"> (e)(4</ref>),<ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal"> (e)(5</ref>), (e<ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">)(6</ref>), or (f) of this section, that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>, as defined in p<ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="internal">aragra</ref>ph (b)(4) of this section, complies with the repayment ability requirements of p<ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">ara</ref>graph (c) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii
paragraph.title: Presumption of compliance for higher-priced covered transactions.
paragraph.content: Presumption of compliance for <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transactions</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or assignee of a qualified mortgage, as defined in paragraph (<ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">e)(2),</ref> (<ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">e)(4),</ref> (e)(<ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">5),</ref> (e)(6), or (f) of this section, that is a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>, as define<ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="internal">d in p</ref>aragraph (b)(4) of this section, is presumed to comply with the repayment ability requirement<ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">s o</ref>f paragraph (c) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: To rebut the presumption of compliance described in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-1-ii-A" reftype="internal">(e)(1)(ii)(A)</ref> of this section, it must be proven that, despite meeting the prerequisites of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, (e)<ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(5)</ref>, (e)(6), or (f) of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> did not make a reasonable and good faith determination of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, by showing that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income, debt obligations, alimony, child support, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment (including <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>) on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> and on any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loans</ref> of which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> was aware at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> would leave the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> with insufficient residual income or assets other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) that secures the loan with which to meet living expenses, including any recurring and material non-debt obligations of which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> was aware at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4
paragraph.title: Repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Repayment ability. Extend <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-32" reftype="internal">1026.32</ref> to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> based on the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s collateral without regard to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability as of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, including the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current and reasonably expected income, employment, assets other than the collateral, current obligations, and mortgage-related obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-i
paragraph.title: Mortgage-related obligations.
paragraph.content: Mortgage-related obligations. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref>, mortgage-related obligations are expected property taxes, premiums for mortgage-related insurance required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> as set forth in § <ref target="1026-35-b-3-i" reftype="internal">1026.35(b), and </ref>similar expenses.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-ii
paragraph.title: Verification of repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Verification of repayment ability. Under this paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability as follows:

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify amounts of income or assets that it relies on to determine repayment ability, including expected income or assets, by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s Internal Revenue Service Form W-2, tax returns, payroll receipts, financial institution records, or other third-party documents that provide reasonably reliable evidence of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii-A" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(ii)(A)</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has not violated paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(ii)</ref> if the amounts of income and assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relied upon in determining repayment ability are not materially greater than the amounts of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> could have verified pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii-A" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(ii)(A)</ref> at the time the loan was consummated.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-ii-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii
paragraph.title: Presumption of compliance.
paragraph.content: Presumption of compliance. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is presumed to have complied with this paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> with respect to a transaction if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii-A
paragraph.content: Verifies the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(ii)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: Determines the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability using the largest payment of principal and interest scheduled in the first seven years following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and taking into account current obligations and mortgage-related obligations as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4-i" reftype="internal">(a)(4)(i)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iii-C
paragraph.content: Assesses the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability taking into account at least one of the following: The ratio of total debt obligations to income, or the income the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have after paying debt obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iv
paragraph.title: Exclusions from presumption of compliance.
paragraph.content: Exclusions from presumption of compliance. Notwithstanding the previous paragraph, no presumption of compliance is available for a transaction for which:

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iv-A
paragraph.content: The regular periodic payments for the first seven years would cause the principal balance to increase; or

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-iv-B
paragraph.content: The term of the loan is less than seven years and the regular periodic payments when aggregated do not fully amortize the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-34-a-4-v
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. This paragraph <ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> does not apply to temporary or “bridge” loans with terms of twelve months or less, such as a loan to purchase a new <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> plans to sell a current <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> within twelve months.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—general.
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—general. Except as provided in paragraph (<ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">e)(4),</ref> (e)<ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(5)</ref>, (e)(6), or (f) of this section, a qualified mortgage is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that are substantially equal, except for the effect that any interest rate change after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> has on the payment in the case of an adjustable-rate or step-rate mortgage, that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Result in an increase of the principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-B
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-ii
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iii
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the loan do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> underwrites the loan, taking into account the monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: Periodic payments of principal and interest that will repay either:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The outstanding principal balance over the remaining term of the loan as of the date the interest rate adjusts to the maximum interest rate set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section, assuming the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have made all required payments as due prior to that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> considers and verifies at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) that secures the loan, in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">(c)(4)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations, alimony, and child support in accordance with appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref> and paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-3" reftype="internal">(c)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi
paragraph.content: For which the ratio of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt to total monthly income at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> does not exceed 43 percent. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-vi" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(vi)</ref>, the ratio of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt to total monthly income is determined:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-vi-B" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(vi)(B)</ref> of this section, in accordance with the standards in appendix <ref target="1026-Q" reftype="internal">Q</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Using the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, including the monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B-2
paragraph.content: Any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> knows or has reason to know will be made, in accordance with paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iv" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iv)</ref> and <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2
paragraph.title: Post-consummation transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage.
paragraph.content: Post-<ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage. A balloon-payment qualified mortgage, extended pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref>, immediately loses its status as a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1" reftype="internal">(f)(1)</ref> if legal title to the balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> except when:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-i
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> three years or more after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the balloon-payment qualified mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-ii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> pursuant to a capital restoration plan or other action under <ref target="USC:12-1831" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1831</ref>o, actions or instructions of any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> acting as conservator, receiver or bankruptcy trustee, an order of a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal governmental agency with jurisdiction to examine the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> pursuant to <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law, or an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and such an agency; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iv
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred pursuant to a merger of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> with another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or acquisition of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> or of another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-a-3-vi
paragraph.content: An extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> made pursuant to a program authorized by sections 101 and 109 of the Emergency Economic Stabilization <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 2008 (<ref target="USC:12-5211" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 5211</ref>; 5219);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6
paragraph.title: Applicability.
paragraph.content: Applicability. This paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> applies only if a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and is not violated if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> do not consummate a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-1
paragraph.title: Repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Requirement to escrow for property taxes and insurance. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(2) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may not extend a <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loan</ref> secured by a first li<ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">en on a consu</ref><ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> unless an escrow account is established before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> for payment of property taxes and premiums for mortgage-related insurance required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, such as insurance against loss of or damage to property, or against liability arising out of the ownership or use of the property, or insurance protecting the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss. For purposes of this paragraph (b), the term “escrow account” has the same meaning as under Regulation X (12 CFR 1024.17(b)), as amended.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3
paragraph.title: Escrows
paragraph.content: Cancellation—

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i
paragraph.title: Failure to escrow for property taxes and insurance.
paragraph.content: General. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(3)(ii) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or s<ref target="1026-35-b-3-ii" reftype="internal">ervicer ma</ref>y cancel an escrow account required in paragraph (b)(1) of this section only upon the earlier of:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Termination of the underlying debt obligation; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Receipt no earlier than five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s request to cancel the escrow account.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions for loans secured by shares in a cooperative and for certain condominium units.
paragraph.content: Delayed cancellation. Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(3)(i) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or servicer shall not cancel an escrow account pursuant to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s request described in paragraph (b)(3)(i)(B) of this section unless the following conditions are satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii-A
paragraph.content: The unpaid principal balance is less than 80 percent of the original value of the property securing the underlying debt obligation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> currently is not delinquent o<ref target="1026-35-b-3-i" reftype="internal">r in defa</ref>ult on the underlying debt obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(1) of this section:<ref target="1026-32-d-6" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i
paragraph.content: An escrow account need not be established for:<ref target="1026-32-d-7" reftype="internal"></ref><ref target="1026-32-a" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-A
paragraph.content: A transaction secured by shares in a cooperative;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-B
paragraph.content: A transaction to finance the initial construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-C
paragraph.content: A temporary or “bridge” loan with a loan term of twelve months or less, such as a loan to purchase a new <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> plans to sell a current <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> within twelve months; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-D
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">reverse mortgage transaction</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-33-c" reftype="internal">1026.33(c)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: Insurance premiums described in paragraph (b)(1) of this section need not be included in escrow accounts for loans secured by <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref> in condominiums, planned unit developments, or other common interest communities in which <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> ownership requires participation in a governing association, where the governing association has an obligation to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> owners to maintain a master policy insuring all <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-v" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, an escrow account need not be established for a transaction if, at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties that are either “rural” or “underserved,” as set forth in paragraph (b)(2)(iv) of th<ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">is section</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: A county is “rural” during a calendar year if it is neither in a metropolitan statistical area nor in a micropolitan statistical area that is adjacent to a metropolitan statistical area, as those terms are defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget and as they are applied under currently applicable Urban Influence Codes (UICs), established by the United <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">States</ref> Department of Agriculture's Economic Research Service (USDA-ERS). A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “rural” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (HMDA) data for the preceding calendar year, no more than two <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> extended covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, five or more times in the county. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-v
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, an escrow account must be established pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loan</ref> that, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, is subject to a commitment to be acquired by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that does not satisfy the conditions in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, unless otherwise exempted by this paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2" reftype="internal">(b)(2)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—temporary balloon-payment qualified mortgage rules.
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—temporary balloon-payment qualified mortgage rules.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6-i
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref> of this section, a qualified mortgage is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6-i-A
paragraph.content: That satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section other than the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-f-1-vi" reftype="internal">(f)(1)(vi)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6-i-B
paragraph.content: For which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> satisfies the requirements stated in § <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-B" reftype="internal">1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(B)</ref> and <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-C" reftype="internal">(C)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6-ii
paragraph.content: The provisions of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-6" reftype="internal">(e)(6)</ref> apply only to <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transactions</ref> consummated on or before January 10, 2016.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-2
paragraph.content: “Average prime offer rate” means an annual percentage rate that is derived from average interest rates, points, and other loan pricing terms currently offered to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> by a representative sample of <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> for mortgage transactions that have low-risk pricing characteristics. The <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> publishes average prime offer rates for a broad range of types of transactions in a table updated at least weekly as well as the methodology the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> uses to derive these rates.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-ii
paragraph.content: The dollar amounts, including the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amounts</ref>, in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3-i" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(i)</ref> of this section shall be adjusted annually on January 1 by the annual percentage change in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for All Urban <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumers</ref> (CPI-U) that was reported on the preceding June 1. See the official commentary to this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3-ii" reftype="internal">(e)(3)(ii)</ref> for the current dollar amounts.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1
paragraph.content: “Higher-priced mortgage loan” means a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref><ref target="1026-35-b-3-v" reftype="internal">it transa</ref>ction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with an annual percentage rate that exceeds the <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="term">average prime offer rate</ref> for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-i
paragraph.content: By 1.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that does not exceed the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: By 2.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that exceeds the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: By 3.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a subordinate lien.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: Periodic payments of principal and interest that will repay either:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The outstanding principal balance over the remaining term of the loan as of the date the interest rate adjusts to the maximum interest rate set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iv-A" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iv)(A)</ref> of this section, assuming the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have made all required payments as due prior to that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref>;
